member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO
member.summary: Contains information used by ShellExecuteEx.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.cbSize
member.summary: Required. The size of this structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.fMask
member.summary: Flags that indicate the content and validity of the other structure members.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hwnd
member.summary: Optional. A handle to the parent window, used to display any message boxes that the system might produce while executing this function. This value can be NULL.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpVerb
member.summary:
A string, referred to as a verb, that specifies the action to be performed. The set of available verbs depends on the particular file or folder. Generally, the actions available from an object's shortcut menu are available verbs. This parameter can be NULL, in which case the default verb is used if available. If not, the "open" verb is used. If neither verb is available, the system uses the first verb listed in the registry. The following verbs are commonly used:
edit Launches an editor and opens the document for editing.If lpFile is not a document file, the function will fail.
explore Explores the folder specified by lpFile.
find Initiates a search starting from the specified directory.
open Opens the file specified by the lpFile parameter. The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder.
print Prints the document file specified by lpFile.If lpFile is not a document file, the function will fail.
properties Displays the file or folder's properties.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpFile
member.summary: The address of a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the file or object on which ShellExecuteEx will perform the action specified by the lpVerb parameter. The system registry verbs that are supported by the ShellExecuteEx function include "open" for executable files and document files and "print" for document files for which a print handler has been registered. Other applications might have added Shell verbs through the system registry, such as "play" for .avi and .wav files. To specify a Shell namespace object, pass the fully qualified parse name and set the SEE_MASK_INVOKEIDLIST flag in the fMask parameter. If the SEE_MASK_INVOKEIDLIST flag is set, you can use either lpFile or lpIDList to identify the item by its file system path or its PIDL respectively. One of the two valueslpFile or lpIDListmust be set.If the path is not included with the name, the current directory is assumed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpParameters
member.summary: Optional. The address of a null-terminated string that contains the application parameters. The parameters must be separated by spaces. If the lpFile member specifies a document file, lpParameters should be NULL.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpDirectory
member.summary: Optional. The address of a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the working directory. If this member is NULL, the current directory is used as the working directory.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.nShellExecuteShow
member.summary: Required. Flags that specify how an application is to be shown when it is opened; one of the SW_ values listed for the ShellExecute function. If lpFile specifies a document file, the flag is simply passed to the associated application. It is up to the application to decide how to handle it.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hInstApp
member.summary: [out] If SEE_MASK_NOCLOSEPROCESS is set and the ShellExecuteEx call succeeds, it sets this member to a value greater than 32. If the function fails, it is set to an SE_ERR_XXX error value that indicates the cause of the failure. Although hInstApp is declared as an HINSTANCE for compatibility with 16-bit Windows applications, it is not a true HINSTANCE. It can be cast only to an int and compared to either 32 or the following SE_ERR_XXX error codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpIDList
member.summary: The address of an absolute ITEMIDLIST structure (PCIDLIST_ABSOLUTE) to contain an item identifier list that uniquely identifies the file to execute. This member is ignored if the fMask member does not include SEE_MASK_IDLIST or SEE_MASK_INVOKEIDLIST.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpClass
member.summary:
The address of a null-terminated string that specifies one of the following:
A ProgId. For example, "Paint.Picture".
A URI protocol scheme. For example, "http".
A file extension. For example, ".txt".
A registry path under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT that names a subkey that contains one or more Shell verbs. This key will have a subkey that conforms to the Shell verb registry schema, such as shell\verb name.
This member is ignored if fMask does not include SEE_MASK_CLASSNAME.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hkeyClass
member.summary: A handle to the registry key for the file type. The access rights for this registry key should be set to KEY_READ. This member is ignored if fMask does not include SEE_MASK_CLASSKEY.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.dwHotKey
member.summary: A keyboard shortcut to associate with the application. The low-order word is the virtual key code, and the high-order word is a modifier flag (HOTKEYF_). For a list of modifier flags, see the description of the WM_SETHOTKEY message. This member is ignored if fMask does not include SEE_MASK_HOTKEY.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hIcon
member.summary:
A handle to the icon for the file type. This member is ignored if fMask does not include SEE_MASK_ICON. This value is used only in Windows XP and earlier. It is ignored as of Windows Vista.
OR
A handle to the monitor upon which the document is to be displayed. This member is ignored if fMask does not include SEE_MASK_HMONITOR.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hProcess
member.summary: A handle to the newly started application. This member is set on return and is always NULL unless fMask is set to SEE_MASK_NOCLOSEPROCESS. Even if fMask is set to SEE_MASK_NOCLOSEPROCESS, hProcess will be NULL if no process was launched. For example, if a document to be launched is a URL and an instance of Internet Explorer is already running, it will display the document. No new process is launched, and hProcess will be NULL. ShellExecuteEx does not always return an hProcess, even if a process is launched as the result of the call. For example, an hProcess does not return when you use SEE_MASK_INVOKEIDLIST to invoke IContextMenu.

member.summary: A value that indicates which operation to perform.

summary.note: This string must be double-null terminated.
summary.para: A pointer to one or more source file names.These names should be fully qualified paths to prevent unexpected results.
Standard MS-DOS wildcard characters, such as "*", are permitted only in the file-name position.Using a wildcard character elsewhere in the string will lead to unpredictable results.

Although this member is declared as a single null-terminated string, it is actually a buffer that can hold multiple null-delimited file names.Each file name is terminated by a single NULL character. The last file name is terminated with a double NULL character ("\0\0") to indicate the end of the buffer.

summary.note: This string must be double-null terminated.
summary.para: A pointer to the destination file or directory name. This parameter must be set to NULL if it is not used. Wildcard characters are not allowed. Their use will lead to unpredictable results.
Like pFrom, the pTo member is also a double-null terminated string and is handled in much the same way. However, pTo must meet the following specifications:

item.description: Copy and Move operations can specify destination directories that do not exist. In those cases, the system attempts to create them and normally displays a dialog box to ask the user if they want to create the new directory. To suppress this dialog box and have the directories created silently, set the FOF_NOCONFIRMMKDIR flag in fFlags.
For Copy and Move operations, the buffer can contain multiple destination file names if the fFlags member specifies FOF_MULTIDESTFILES.
Pack multiple names into the pTo string in the same way as for pFrom.
Use fully qualified paths. Using relative paths is not prohibited, but can have unpredictable results.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.AUTOCOMPLETEOPTIONS.ACO_USETAB
member.summary: Use the TAB key to select an item from the drop-down list.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.AUTOCOMPLETEOPTIONS.ACO_UPDOWNKEYDROPSLIST
member.summary: Use the UP ARROW and DOWN ARROW keys to display the autosuggest drop-down list.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.AUTOCOMPLETEOPTIONS.ACO_RTLREADING
member.summary: Normal windows display text left-to-right (LTR). Windows can be mirrored to display languages such as Hebrew or Arabic that read right-to-left (RTL). Typically, control text is displayed in the same direction as the text in its parent window. If ACO_RTLREADING is set, the text reads in the opposite direction from the text in the parent window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.AUTOCOMPLETEOPTIONS.ACO_WORD_FILTER
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. If set, the autocompleted suggestion is treated as a phrase for search purposes. The suggestion, Microsoft Office, would be treated as "Microsoft Office" (where both Microsoft AND Office must appear in the search results).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.AUTOCOMPLETEOPTIONS.ACO_NOPREFIXFILTERING
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Disable prefix filtering when displaying the autosuggest dropdown. Always display all suggestions.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OfflineFolderStatus

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OfflineFolderStatus.OFS_DIRTYCACHE
member.summary: Server is online with unsynchronized changes.

member.summary: Server is offline.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OfflineFolderStatus.OFS_ONLINE
member.summary: Server is online.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OfflineFolderStatus.OFS_SERVERBACK
member.summary: Server is offline but can be reached.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants
member.summary: Specifies unique, system-independent values that identify special folders. These folders are frequently used by applications but which may not have the same name or location on any given system. For example, the system folder can be "C:\Windows" on one system and "C:\Winnt" on another.

remarks.para: The values in this enumeration are equivalent to their corresponding CSIDL or KNOWNFOLDERID values, used in C++ applications. They supersede the use of environment variables for this purpose. Note that not all CSIDL or KNOWNFOLDERID values have an equivalent value in ShellSpecialFolderConstants.

Note Where a constant identifies a file system folder, a commonly used path on Windows Vista systems is given as an example. However, there is no guarantee that this path will be used on any particular system, including Windows Vista systems.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfDESKTOP
member.summary: 0x00 (0). Windows desktopthe virtual folder that is the root of the namespace.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfPROGRAMS
member.summary: 0x02 (2). File system directory that contains the user's program groups (which are also file system directories). A typical path is C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfCONTROLS
member.summary: 0x03 (3). Virtual folder that contains icons for the Control Panel applications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfPRINTERS
member.summary: 0x04 (4). Virtual folder that contains installed printers.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfPERSONAL
member.summary: 0x05 (5). File system directory that serves as a common repository for a user's documents. A typical path is C:\Users\username\Documents.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfFAVORITES
member.summary: 0x06 (6). File system directory that serves as a common repository for the user's favorite URLs. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Favorites.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfSTARTUP
member.summary: 0x07 (7). File system directory that corresponds to the user's Startup program group. The system starts these programs whenever any user first logs into their profile after a reboot. A typical path is C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\StartUp.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfRECENT
member.summary: 0x08 (8). File system directory that contains the user's most recently used documents. A typical path is C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Recent.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfSENDTO
member.summary: 0x09 (9). File system directory that contains Send To menu items. A typical path is C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\SendTo.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfBITBUCKET
member.summary: 0x0a (10). Virtual folder that contains the objects in the user's Recycle Bin.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfSTARTMENU
member.summary: 0x0b (11). File system directory that contains Start menu items. A typical path is C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfDESKTOPDIRECTORY
member.summary: 0x10 (16). File system directory used to physically store the file objects that are displayed on the desktop. It is not to be confused with the desktop folder itself, which is a virtual folder. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Desktop.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfDRIVES
member.summary: 0x11 (17). My Computerthe virtual folder that contains everything on the local computer: storage devices, printers, and Control Panel. This folder can also contain mapped network drives.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfNETWORK
member.summary: 0x12 (18). Network Neighborhoodthe virtual folder that represents the root of the network namespace hierarchy.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfNETHOOD
member.summary: 0x13 (19). A file system folder that contains any link objects in the My Network Places virtual folder. It is not the same as ssfNETWORK, which represents the network namespace root. A typical path is C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Network Shortcuts.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfFONTS
member.summary: 0x14 (20). Virtual folder that contains installed fonts. A typical path is C:\Windows\Fonts.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfTEMPLATES
member.summary: 0x15 (21). File system directory that serves as a common repository for document templates.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfCOMMONSTARTMENU
member.summary: 0x16 (22). File system directory that contains the programs and folders that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfCOMMONPROGRAMS
member.summary: 0x17 (23). File system directory that contains the directories for the common program groups that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfCOMMONSTARTUP
member.summary: 0x18 (24). File system directory that contains the programs that appear in the Startup folder for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\StartUp. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfCOMMONDESKTOPDIR
member.summary: 0x19 (25). File system directory that contains files and folders that appear on the desktop for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Desktop. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfAPPDATA
member.summary: 0x1a (26). Version 4.71. File system directory that serves as a common repository for application-specific data. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Application Data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfPRINTHOOD
member.summary: 0x1b (27). File system directory that contains any link objects in the Printers virtual folder. A typical path is C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Printer Shortcuts.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfLOCALAPPDATA
member.summary: 0x1c (28). Version 5.0. File system directory that serves as a data repository for local (non-roaming) applications. A typical path is C:\Users\username\AppData\Local.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfALTSTARTUP
member.summary: 0x1d (29). File system directory that corresponds to the user's non-localized Startup program group.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfCOMMONALTSTARTUP
member.summary: 0x1e (30). File system directory that corresponds to the non-localized Startup program group for all users. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfCOMMONFAVORITES
member.summary: 0x1f (31). File system directory that serves as a common repository for the favorite URLs shared by all users. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfINTERNETCACHE
member.summary: 0x20 (32). File system directory that serves as a common repository for temporary Internet files. A typical path is C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\Temporary Internet Files.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfCOOKIES
member.summary: 0x21 (33). File system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet cookies. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Application Data\Microsoft\Windows\Cookies.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfHISTORY
member.summary: 0x22 (34). File system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet history items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfCOMMONAPPDATA
member.summary: 0x23 (35). Version 5.0. Application data for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application Data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfWINDOWS
member.summary: 0x24 (36). Version 5.0. Windows directory. This corresponds to the %windir% or %SystemRoot% environment variables. A typical path is C:\Windows.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfSYSTEM
member.summary: 0x25 (37). Version 5.0. The System folder. A typical path is C:\Windows\System32.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfPROGRAMFILES
member.summary: 0x26 (38). Version 5.0. Program Files folder. A typical path is C:\Program Files.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfMYPICTURES
member.summary: 0x27 (39). My Pictures folder. A typical path is C:\Users\username\Pictures.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfPROFILE
member.summary: 0x28 (40). Version 5.0. User's profile folder.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfSYSTEMx86
member.summary: 0x29 (41). Version 5.0. System folder. A typical path is C:\Windows\System32, or C:\Windows\Syswow32 on a 64-bit computer.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellSpecialFolderConstants.ssfPROGRAMFILESx86
member.summary: 0x30 (48). Version 6.0. Program Files folder. A typical path is C:\Program Files, or C:\Program Files (X86) on a 64-bit computer.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.Folder
member.summary: Represents a Shell folder. This object contains properties and methods that allow you to retrieve information about the folder.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.Folder.Title
member.summary: Contains the title of the folder.
member.value: Returns a value.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.Folder.Application
member.summary: Contains the folder's Application object.
member.value: An object reference to the Application object.
member.remarks:
The Application property returns the automation object supported by the application that contains the WebBrowser control, if that object is accessible. Otherwise, this property returns the WebBrowser control's automation object.
Use this property with the Set and CreateObject commands or with the GetObject command to create and manipulate an instance of the Internet Explorer application.
Not all methods are implemented for all folders. For example, the ParseName method is not implemented for the Control Panel folder (CSIDL_CONTROLS). If you attempt to call an unimplemented method, a 0x800A01BD (decimal 445) error is raised.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.Folder.Parent
member.summary: This property is not implemented.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.Folder.ParentFolder
member.summary: Contains the parent Folder object.
member.value: An object reference to the ParentFolder object.

remarks.note: Not all methods are implemented for all folders. For example, the ParseName method is not implemented for the Control Panel folder (CSIDL_CONTROLS). If you attempt to call an unimplemented method, a 0x800A01BD (decimal 445) error is raised.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.Folder.Items
member.summary: Retrieves a FolderItems object that represents the collection of items in the folder.
member.returns: An object reference to the FolderItems object.

remarks.note: Not all methods are implemented for all folders. For example, the ParseName method is not implemented for the Control Panel folder (CSIDL_CONTROLS). If you attempt to call an unimplemented method, a 0x800A01BD (decimal 445) error is raised.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.Folder.ParseName(System.String)
member.summary: Creates and returns a FolderItem object that represents a specified item.
member.param: A string that specifies the name of the item.
member.returns: An object reference to the FolderItem object.
member.remarks: ParseName should not be used for virtual folders such as My Documents.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.Folder.NewFolder(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new folder.
member.param: A string that specifies the name of the new folder.
This value is not currently used.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.Folder.MoveHere(System.Object,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FILEOP_FLAGS)
member.summary: Moves an item or items to this folder.
member.param: The item or items to move. This can be a string that represents a file name, a FolderItem object, or a FolderItems object.

Options for the move operation. This value can be zero or a combination of the following values. These values are based upon flags defined for use with the fFlags member of the C++ SHFILEOPSTRUCT structure. These flags are not defined as such for Visual Basic, VBScript, or JScript, so you must define them yourself or use their numeric equivalents.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.Folder.CopyHere(System.Object,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FILEOP_FLAGS)
member.summary: Copies an item or items to a folder.
member.param: The item or items to copy. This can be a string that represents a file name, a FolderItem object, or a FolderItems object.

Options for the copy operation. This value can be zero or a combination of the following values. These values are based upon flags defined for use with the fFlags member of the C++ SHFILEOPSTRUCT structure. Each Shell namespace must provide its own implementation of these flags, and each namespace can choose to ignore some or even all of these flags. These flags are not defined by name for Visual Basic, VBScript, or JScript, so you must define them yourself or use their numeric equivalents.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.Folder.GetDetailsOf(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves details about an item in a folder. For example, its size, type, or the time of its last modification.
member.param: The item for which to retrieve the information. This must be a FolderItem object.

An Integer value that specifies the information to be retrieved. The information available for an item depends on the folder in which it is displayed. This value corresponds to the zero-based column number that is displayed in a Shell view.
member.returns: String containing the retrieved detail.

The Application property returns the automation object supported by the application that contains the WebBrowser control, if that object is accessible. Otherwise, this property returns the WebBrowser control's automation object.
Use this property with the Set and CreateObject commands or with the GetObject command to create and manipulate an instance of the Internet Explorer application.

member.returns: An object reference to the FolderItemVerbs object.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FolderItem.InvokeVerb(System.String)
member.summary: Executes a verb on the item.
member.param: A string that specifies the verb to be executed. It must be one of the values returned by the item's FolderItemVerb.Name property. If no verb is specified, the default verb will be invoked.
member.remarks:
A verb is a string used to specify a particular action that an item supports. Invoking a verb is equivalent to selecting a command from an item's shortcut menu. Typically, invoking a verb launches a related application. For example, invoking the "open" verb on a .txt file opens the file with a text editor, usually Microsoft Notepad. See Launching Applications for further discussion of verbs.
The FolderItemVerbs object represents the collection of verbs associated with the item.The default verb may vary for different items, but it is typically "open".

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IAutoComplete
member.summary: Exposed by the autocomplete object (CLSID_AutoComplete). This interface allows applications to initialize, enable, and disable the object.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IAutoComplete.Init(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IEnumString,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the autocomplete object.
member.param: A handle to the window for the system edit control for which autocompletion will be enabled.
A pointer to the IUnknown interface of the string list object that generates candidates for the completed string. The object must expose an IEnumString interface.

A pointer to an optional, null-terminated Unicode string that gives the registry path, including the value name, where the format string is stored as a REG_SZ value. The autocomplete object first looks for the path under HKEY_CURRENT_USER. If it fails, it tries HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. For a discussion of the format string, see the definition of pwszQuickComplete.

A pointer to an optional null-terminated Unicode string that specifies the format to be used if the user enters text and presses CTRL+ENTER. Set this parameter to NULL to disable quick completion. Otherwise, the autocomplete object treats pwszQuickComplete as a StringCchPrintf format string and the text in the edit box as its associated argument, to produce a new string. For example, set pwszQuickComplete to "http://www.%s.com/". When a user enters "MyURL" into the edit box and presses CTRL+ENTER, the text in the edit box is updated to "http://www.MyURL.com/".

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IAutoComplete.Enable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables autocompletion.
member.param: A value that is set to TRUE to enable autocompletion, or FALSE to disable it.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IAutoComplete2
member.summary: Extends IAutoComplete. This interface enables clients of the autocomplete object to retrieve and set a number of options that control how autocompletion operates.

member.param: A handle to the window for the system edit control for which autocompletion will be enabled.

A pointer to an optional, null-terminated Unicode string that gives the registry path, including the value name, where the format string is stored as a REG_SZ value. The autocomplete object first looks for the path under HKEY_CURRENT_USER. If it fails, it tries HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. For a discussion of the format string, see the definition of pwszQuickComplete.

A pointer to an optional null-terminated Unicode string that specifies the format to be used if the user enters text and presses CTRL+ENTER. Set this parameter to NULL to disable quick completion. Otherwise, the autocomplete object treats pwszQuickComplete as a StringCchPrintf format string and the text in the edit box as its associated argument, to produce a new string. For example, set pwszQuickComplete to "http://www.%s.com/". When a user enters "MyURL" into the edit box and presses CTRL+ENTER, the text in the edit box is updated to "http://www.MyURL.com/".

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INewWDEvents
member.summary: Extends the WebWizardHost object by enabling server-side pages hosted in a wizard to verify that the user has been authenticated through a Microsoft account.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INewWDEvents.FinalBack
member.summary: Navigates to the client-side page immediately preceding the page hosting the server-side HTML pages.
member.remarks: When the wizard displays the first server-side page and the user clicks the Back button, the server invokes FinalBack when notified of that event by the client's event handler.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INewWDEvents.FinalNext
member.summary: Navigates to the client-side wizard page that follows the page that hosts the server-side HTML pages, or finishes the wizard if there are no further client-side pages.
member.remarks: When the wizard is displaying the last server-side HTML page and the user clicks the Next or Finish button, the server invokes FinalNext in that button's event handler.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INewWDEvents.Cancel
member.summary: Simulates a Cancel button click.
member.remarks: The client is responsible for responding to this method with the expected behavior by closing the wizard.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INewWDEvents.Caption
member.summary: This property is not implemented.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INewWDEvents.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Sets or retrieves a property's current value.
member.value: The property value.
member.param: Name of the property.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INewWDEvents.SetWizardButtons(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the Back, Next, and Finish buttons in the client's wizard frame.
member.param: Enables the Back button.
Enables the Next button.
Enables the Finish button. States that this is the last server-side page.
member.remarks: Be sure to implement handler functions in each server-side page for OnBack() and OnNext(), corresponding to the wizard buttons Back and Next. The OnBack() and OnNext() functions respond to SetWizardButtons. At the appropriate time, the OnNext() function calls SetWizardButtons with vbLastPage= true, which can enable a Finish button. OnNext() also calls FinalNext when a user clicks the Finish button.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INewWDEvents.SetHeaderText(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the title and subtitle that appear in the wizard header. In general, the client will display the header above the HTML and below the title bar.
member.param: String containing the title.
String containing the subtitle.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INewWDEvents.PassportAuthenticate(System.String)
member.summary: Enables server-side pages hosted in a wizard to verify that the user has been authenticated through a Microsoft account.
member.param: A string containing the URL of a webpage that redirects to the Microsoft account log on UI.
member.returns: Set to true if authentication succeeds, false otherwise.
member.remarks: This method may be called even if a user is already logged on to a Microsoft account. In that case, the method returns true without displaying the Microsoft account log on UI.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch
member.summary: Represents an object in the Shell. Methods are provided to control the Shell and to execute commands within the Shell. There are also methods to obtain other Shell-related objects.

summary.para: Contains an object that represents an application.
This property is read-only.

remarks.para: This property is implemented and accessed through the Shell.EjectPC property.

The Application property returns the automation object supported by the application that contains the WebBrowser control, if that object is accessible. Otherwise, this property returns the WebBrowser control's automation object.
Use this property with the Set and CreateObject commands or with the GetObject command to create and manipulate an instance of the Windows Internet Explorer application.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch.Parent

summary.para: Retrieves an object that represents the parent of the current object.
This property is read-only.

member.remarks: This property is implemented and accessed through the Shell.Parent property.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch.NameSpace(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellFolderViewOptions)
member.summary: Creates and returns a Folder object for the specified folder.

param.name: vDir
param.para: The folder for which to create the Folder object. This can be a string that specifies the path of the folder or one of the ShellSpecialFolderConstants values. Note that the constant names found in ShellSpecialFolderConstants are available in Visual Basic, but not in VBScript or JScript. In those cases, the numeric values must be used in their place.

returns.para: Object reference to the Folder object for the specified folder. If the folder is not successfully created, this value returns null.
Object reference to the Folder object for the specified folder. If the folder is not successfully created, this value returns null.

member.remarks: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.NameSpace method.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch.BrowseForFolder(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a dialog box that enables the user to select a folder and then returns the selected folder's Folder object.

param.name: Hwnd
param.para: The handle to the parent window of the dialog box. This value can be zero.

param.name: Title
param.para: A String value that represents the title displayed inside the Browse dialog box.

param.name: Options
param.para: An Integer value that contains the options for the method. This can be zero or a combination of the values listed under the ulFlags member of the BROWSEINFO structure.

param.name: RootFolder
param.para: The root folder to use in the dialog box. The user cannot browse higher in the tree than this folder. If this value is not specified, the root folder used in the dialog box is the desktop. This value can be a string that specifies the path of the folder or one of the ShellSpecialFolderConstants values. Note that the constant names found in ShellSpecialFolderConstants are available in Visual Basic, but not in VBScript or JScript. In those cases, the numeric values must be used in their place.

returns.para: An object reference to the selected folder's Folder object.
An object reference to the selected folder's Folder object.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch2
member.summary: Extends the IShellDispatch object with a variety of new functionality.
member.remarks: For a discussion of Windows services, see the Services documentation.

summary.para: Contains an object that represents an application.
This property is read-only.

remarks.para: This property is implemented and accessed through the Shell.EjectPC property.

The Application property returns the automation object supported by the application that contains the WebBrowser control, if that object is accessible. Otherwise, this property returns the WebBrowser control's automation object.
Use this property with the Set and CreateObject commands or with the GetObject command to create and manipulate an instance of the Windows Internet Explorer application.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch2.BrowseForFolder(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a dialog box that enables the user to select a folder and then returns the selected folder's Folder object.

param.name: Hwnd
param.para: The handle to the parent window of the dialog box. This value can be zero.

param.name: Title
param.para: A String value that represents the title displayed inside the Browse dialog box.

param.name: Options
param.para: An Integer value that contains the options for the method. This can be zero or a combination of the values listed under the ulFlags member of the BROWSEINFO structure.

param.name: RootFolder
param.para: The root folder to use in the dialog box. The user cannot browse higher in the tree than this folder. If this value is not specified, the root folder used in the dialog box is the desktop. This value can be a string that specifies the path of the folder or one of the ShellSpecialFolderConstants values. Note that the constant names found in ShellSpecialFolderConstants are available in Visual Basic, but not in VBScript or JScript. In those cases, the numeric values must be used in their place.

returns.para: An object reference to the selected folder's Folder object.
An object reference to the selected folder's Folder object.

member.remarks: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.BrowseForFolder method.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch2.IsRestricted(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a group's restriction setting from the registry.

param.name: sGroup
param.para: A String that contains the group name. This value is the name of a registry subkey under which to check for the restriction.

param.name: sRestriction
param.para: A String that contains the restriction whose value is to be retrieved.

returns.para: The value of the restriction. If the specified restriction is not found, the return value is 0.
The value of the restriction. If the specified restriction is not found, the return value is 0.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.IsRestricted method.
IsRestricted first looks for a subkey name that matches sGroup under the following key.

Restrictions are declared as values of the individual policy subkeys. If the restriction named in sRestriction is found in the subkey named in sGroup, IsRestricted returns the restriction's current value. If the restriction is not found under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, the same subkey is checked under HKEY_CURRENT_USER.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch2.ShellExecute(System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Performs a specified operation on a specified file.

param.name: sFile
param.para: A String that contains the name of the file on which ShellExecute will perform the action specified by vOperation.

param.name: vArguments
param.para: A string that contains parameter values for the operation.

param.name: vDirectory
param.para: The fully qualified path of the directory that contains the file specified by sFile. If this parameter is not specified, the current working directory is used.

param.name: vOperation
param.para: The operation to be performed. This value is set to one of the verb strings that is supported by the file. For a discussion of verbs, see the Remarks section. If this parameter is not specified, the default operation is performed.

param.name: vShow
param.para: A recommendation as to how the application window should be displayed initially. The application can ignore this recommendation. This parameter can be one of the following values. If this parameter is not specified, the application uses its default value.

item.term: Open the application with a hidden window.
Open the application with a normal window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position.
Open the application with a minimized window.
Open the application with a maximized window.
Open the application with its window at its most recent size and position. The active window remains active.
Open the application with its window at its current size and position.
Open the application with a minimized window. The active window remains active.
Open the application with its window in the default state specified by the application.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.ShellExecute method.

This method is equivalent to launching one of the commands associated with a file's shortcut menu. Each command is represented by a verb string. The set of supported verbs varies from file to file. The most commonly supported verb is "open", which is also usually the default verb. Other verbs might be supported by only certain types of files. For further discussion of Shell verbs, see Launching Applications or Extending Shortcut Menus.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch2.FindPrinter(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays the Find Printer dialog box.

param.name: Name
param.para: A String that contains the printer name.

param.name: location
param.para: A String that contains the printer location.

param.name: model
param.para: A String that contains the printer model.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.FindPrinter method.

If you assign strings to one or more of the optional parameters, they are displayed as default values in the associated edit control when the Find Printer dialog box is displayed. The user can either accept or override these values. If no value is assigned to a parameter, the associated edit box is empty and the user must enter a value.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch2.GetSystemInformation(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves system information.

param.name: sName
param.para: A String that specifies the system information that is being requested.

returns.para: Returns the value of the requested system information. The return type depends on which system information is requested. See the Remarks section for details.
Returns the value of the requested system information. The return type depends on which system information is requested. See the Remarks section for details.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.GetSystemInformation method.
This method can be used to request many system information values. The following table gives the sName value that is used to request the information and the associated type of the returned value.
sName
Return type
Description
DirectoryServiceAvailable
Set to true if the directory service is available; otherwise, false.
DoubleClickTime
The double-click time, in milliseconds.
ProcessorLevel
Windows Vista and later. The processor level. Returns 3, 4, or 5, for x386, x486, and Pentium-level processors, respectively.
ProcessorSpeed
The processor speed, in megahertz (MHz).
ProcessorArchitecture
The processor architecture. For details, see the discussion of the wProcessorArchitecture member of the SYSTEM_INFO structure.
PhysicalMemoryInstalled
The amount of physical memory installed, in bytes.
The following are valid only on Windows XP.
IsOS_Professional
Set to true if the operating system is Windows XP Professional Edition; otherwise, false.
IsOS_Personal
Set to true if the operating system is Windows XP Home Edition; otherwise, false.
The following is valid only on Windows XP and later.
IsOS_DomainMember
Set to true if the computer is a member of a domain; otherwise, false.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch2.ServiceStart(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts a named service.

param.name: sServiceName
param.para: A String that contains the name of the service.

param.name: vPersistent
param.para: Set to true to have the service started automatically by the service control manager during system startup. Set to false to leave the service configuration unchanged.

returns.para: Returns true if successful; otherwise, false.
Returns true if successful; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.ServiceStart method.
The method returns false if the service has already been started. Before calling this method, you can call Shell.IsServiceRunning to ascertain the status of the service.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch2.ServiceStop(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Stops a named service.

param.para: A String that contains the name of the service.

param.name: vPersistent
param.para: Set to true to have the service started by the service control manager when ServiceStart is called. To leave the service configuration unchanged, set vPersistent to false.

returns.para: Returns true if successful; otherwise, false.
Returns true if successful; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.ServiceStop method.
The method returns false if the service has already been stopped. Before calling this method, you can call Shell.IsServiceRunning to ascertain the status of the service.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.summary: Creates a dialog box that enables the user to select a folder and then returns the selected folder's Folder object.

param.name: Hwnd
param.para: The handle to the parent window of the dialog box. This value can be zero.

param.name: Title
param.para: A String value that represents the title displayed inside the Browse dialog box.

param.name: Options
param.para: An Integer value that contains the options for the method. This can be zero or a combination of the values listed under the ulFlags member of the BROWSEINFO structure.

param.name: RootFolder
param.para: The root folder to use in the dialog box. The user cannot browse higher in the tree than this folder. If this value is not specified, the root folder used in the dialog box is the desktop. This value can be a string that specifies the path of the folder or one of the ShellSpecialFolderConstants values. Note that the constant names found in ShellSpecialFolderConstants are available in Visual Basic, but not in VBScript or JScript. In those cases, the numeric values must be used in their place.

returns.para: An object reference to the selected folder's Folder object.
An object reference to the selected folder's Folder object.

member.remarks: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.BrowseForFolder method.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch3.IsRestricted(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a group's restriction setting from the registry.

param.name: sGroup
param.para: A String that contains the group name. This value is the name of a registry subkey under which to check for the restriction.

param.name: sRestriction
param.para: A String that contains the restriction whose value is to be retrieved.

returns.para: The value of the restriction. If the specified restriction is not found, the return value is 0.
The value of the restriction. If the specified restriction is not found, the return value is 0.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.IsRestricted method.
IsRestricted first looks for a subkey name that matches sGroup under the following key.

Restrictions are declared as values of the individual policy subkeys. If the restriction named in sRestriction is found in the subkey named in sGroup, IsRestricted returns the restriction's current value. If the restriction is not found under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, the same subkey is checked under HKEY_CURRENT_USER.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch3.ShellExecute(System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Performs a specified operation on a specified file.

param.name: sFile
param.para: A String that contains the name of the file on which ShellExecute will perform the action specified by vOperation.

param.name: vArguments
param.para: A string that contains parameter values for the operation.

param.name: vDirectory
param.para: The fully qualified path of the directory that contains the file specified by sFile. If this parameter is not specified, the current working directory is used.

param.name: vOperation
param.para: The operation to be performed. This value is set to one of the verb strings that is supported by the file. For a discussion of verbs, see the Remarks section. If this parameter is not specified, the default operation is performed.

param.name: vShow
param.para: A recommendation as to how the application window should be displayed initially. The application can ignore this recommendation. This parameter can be one of the following values. If this parameter is not specified, the application uses its default value.

item.term: Open the application with a hidden window.
Open the application with a normal window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position.
Open the application with a minimized window.
Open the application with a maximized window.
Open the application with its window at its most recent size and position. The active window remains active.
Open the application with its window at its current size and position.
Open the application with a minimized window. The active window remains active.
Open the application with its window in the default state specified by the application.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.ShellExecute method.

This method is equivalent to launching one of the commands associated with a file's shortcut menu. Each command is represented by a verb string. The set of supported verbs varies from file to file. The most commonly supported verb is "open", which is also usually the default verb. Other verbs might be supported by only certain types of files. For further discussion of Shell verbs, see Launching Applications or Extending Shortcut Menus.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch3.FindPrinter(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays the Find Printer dialog box.

param.name: Name
param.para: A String that contains the printer name.

param.name: location
param.para: A String that contains the printer location.

param.name: model
param.para: A String that contains the printer model.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.FindPrinter method.

If you assign strings to one or more of the optional parameters, they are displayed as default values in the associated edit control when the Find Printer dialog box is displayed. The user can either accept or override these values. If no value is assigned to a parameter, the associated edit box is empty and the user must enter a value.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch3.GetSystemInformation(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves system information.

param.name: sName
param.para: A String that specifies the system information that is being requested.

returns.para: Returns the value of the requested system information. The return type depends on which system information is requested. See the Remarks section for details.
Returns the value of the requested system information. The return type depends on which system information is requested. See the Remarks section for details.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.GetSystemInformation method.
This method can be used to request many system information values. The following table gives the sName value that is used to request the information and the associated type of the returned value.
sName
Return type
Description
DirectoryServiceAvailable
Set to true if the directory service is available; otherwise, false.
DoubleClickTime
The double-click time, in milliseconds.
ProcessorLevel
Windows Vista and later. The processor level. Returns 3, 4, or 5, for x386, x486, and Pentium-level processors, respectively.
ProcessorSpeed
The processor speed, in megahertz (MHz).
ProcessorArchitecture
The processor architecture. For details, see the discussion of the wProcessorArchitecture member of the SYSTEM_INFO structure.
PhysicalMemoryInstalled
The amount of physical memory installed, in bytes.
The following are valid only on Windows XP.
IsOS_Professional
Set to true if the operating system is Windows XP Professional Edition; otherwise, false.
IsOS_Personal
Set to true if the operating system is Windows XP Home Edition; otherwise, false.
The following is valid only on Windows XP and later.
IsOS_DomainMember
Set to true if the computer is a member of a domain; otherwise, false.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch3.ServiceStart(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts a named service.

param.name: sServiceName
param.para: A String that contains the name of the service.

param.name: vPersistent
param.para: Set to true to have the service started automatically by the service control manager during system startup. Set to false to leave the service configuration unchanged.

returns.para: Returns true if successful; otherwise, false.
Returns true if successful; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.ServiceStart method.
The method returns false if the service has already been started. Before calling this method, you can call Shell.IsServiceRunning to ascertain the status of the service.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch3.ServiceStop(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Stops a named service.

param.name: sServiceName
param.para: A String that contains the name of the service.

param.name: vPersistent
param.para: Set to true to have the service started by the service control manager when ServiceStart is called. To leave the service configuration unchanged, set vPersistent to false.

returns.para: Returns true if successful; otherwise, false.
Returns true if successful; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.ServiceStop method.
The method returns false if the service has already been stopped. Before calling this method, you can call Shell.IsServiceRunning to ascertain the status of the service.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch4
member.summary: Extends the IShellDispatch3 object. In addition to the properties and methods supported by IShellDispatch3, IShellDispatch4 supports four additional methods.
member.remarks: For a discussion of Windows services, see the Services documentation.

summary.para: Contains an object that represents an application.
This property is read-only.

remarks.para: This property is implemented and accessed through the Shell.EjectPC property.

The Application property returns the automation object supported by the application that contains the WebBrowser control, if that object is accessible. Otherwise, this property returns the WebBrowser control's automation object.
Use this property with the Set and CreateObject commands or with the GetObject command to create and manipulate an instance of the Windows Internet Explorer application.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch4.IsRestricted(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a group's restriction setting from the registry.

param.name: sGroup
param.para: A String that contains the group name. This value is the name of a registry subkey under which to check for the restriction.

param.name: sRestriction
param.para: A String that contains the restriction whose value is to be retrieved.

returns.para: The value of the restriction. If the specified restriction is not found, the return value is 0.
The value of the restriction. If the specified restriction is not found, the return value is 0.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.IsRestricted method.
IsRestricted first looks for a subkey name that matches sGroup under the following key.

Restrictions are declared as values of the individual policy subkeys. If the restriction named in sRestriction is found in the subkey named in sGroup, IsRestricted returns the restriction's current value. If the restriction is not found under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, the same subkey is checked under HKEY_CURRENT_USER.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch4.ShellExecute(System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Performs a specified operation on a specified file.

param.name: sFile
param.para: A String that contains the name of the file on which ShellExecute will perform the action specified by vOperation.

param.name: vArguments
param.para: A string that contains parameter values for the operation.

param.name: vDirectory
param.para: The fully qualified path of the directory that contains the file specified by sFile. If this parameter is not specified, the current working directory is used.

param.name: vOperation
param.para: The operation to be performed. This value is set to one of the verb strings that is supported by the file. For a discussion of verbs, see the Remarks section. If this parameter is not specified, the default operation is performed.

param.name: vShow
param.para: A recommendation as to how the application window should be displayed initially. The application can ignore this recommendation. This parameter can be one of the following values. If this parameter is not specified, the application uses its default value.

item.term: Open the application with a hidden window.
Open the application with a normal window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position.
Open the application with a minimized window.
Open the application with a maximized window.
Open the application with its window at its most recent size and position. The active window remains active.
Open the application with its window at its current size and position.
Open the application with a minimized window. The active window remains active.
Open the application with its window in the default state specified by the application.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.ShellExecute method.

This method is equivalent to launching one of the commands associated with a file's shortcut menu. Each command is represented by a verb string. The set of supported verbs varies from file to file. The most commonly supported verb is "open", which is also usually the default verb. Other verbs might be supported by only certain types of files. For further discussion of Shell verbs, see Launching Applications or Extending Shortcut Menus.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch4.FindPrinter(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays the Find Printer dialog box.

param.name: Name
param.para: A String that contains the printer name.

param.name: location
param.para: A String that contains the printer location.

param.name: model
param.para: A String that contains the printer model.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.FindPrinter method.

If you assign strings to one or more of the optional parameters, they are displayed as default values in the associated edit control when the Find Printer dialog box is displayed. The user can either accept or override these values. If no value is assigned to a parameter, the associated edit box is empty and the user must enter a value.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch4.GetSystemInformation(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves system information.

param.name: sName
param.para: A String that specifies the system information that is being requested.

returns.para: Returns the value of the requested system information. The return type depends on which system information is requested. See the Remarks section for details.
Returns the value of the requested system information. The return type depends on which system information is requested. See the Remarks section for details.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.GetSystemInformation method.
This method can be used to request many system information values. The following table gives the sName value that is used to request the information and the associated type of the returned value.
sName
Return type
Description
DirectoryServiceAvailable
Set to true if the directory service is available; otherwise, false.
DoubleClickTime
The double-click time, in milliseconds.
ProcessorLevel
Windows Vista and later. The processor level. Returns 3, 4, or 5, for x386, x486, and Pentium-level processors, respectively.
ProcessorSpeed
The processor speed, in megahertz (MHz).
ProcessorArchitecture
The processor architecture. For details, see the discussion of the wProcessorArchitecture member of the SYSTEM_INFO structure.
PhysicalMemoryInstalled
The amount of physical memory installed, in bytes.
The following are valid only on Windows XP.
IsOS_Professional
Set to true if the operating system is Windows XP Professional Edition; otherwise, false.
IsOS_Personal
Set to true if the operating system is Windows XP Home Edition; otherwise, false.
The following is valid only on Windows XP and later.
IsOS_DomainMember
Set to true if the computer is a member of a domain; otherwise, false.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch4.ServiceStart(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts a named service.

param.name: sServiceName
param.para: A String that contains the name of the service.

param.name: vPersistent
param.para: Set to true to have the service started automatically by the service control manager during system startup. Set to false to leave the service configuration unchanged.

returns.para: Returns true if successful; otherwise, false.
Returns true if successful; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.ServiceStart method.
The method returns false if the service has already been started. Before calling this method, you can call Shell.IsServiceRunning to ascertain the status of the service.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

The method returns false if the service has already been stopped. Before calling this method, you can call Shell.IsServiceRunning to ascertain the status of the service.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch4.WindowsSecurity
member.summary: Displays the Windows Security dialog box.
member.remarks: This method displays the dialog box shown after pressing CTRL+ALT+DELETE or using the security option on the Start menu.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch4.ToggleDesktop
member.summary: Displays or hides the desktop.
member.remarks: This method has the same effect as the Show Desktop button on the taskbar. It either hides all open windows to show the desktop or it hides the desktop by showing all open windows. The ToggleDesktop method does not display a user interface, it just invokes the toggle action.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch4.ExplorerPolicy(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value for a specified Windows Internet Explorer policy.
member.param: A String that specifies the name of the policy.

returns.para: The value associated with the specified policy name.
The value associated with the specified policy name.

remarks.para: Network Administrators can control and manage the computing environment of their users by setting policies.
The specified value name must be within the HKEY_CURRENT_USER\ Software\ Microsoft\ Windows\ CurrentVersion\ Policies\ Explorer subkey. If the value name does not exist then the method returns null.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch4.GetSetting(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SSF)
member.summary: Retrieves a global Shell setting.
member.param: A value that specifies the current Shell setting to retrieve. Only one setting can be retrieved in each call. The following values are recognized by this method.
member.returns: Set to true if the setting exists; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch5
member.summary: Extends the IShellDispatch4 object. In addition to the properties and methods supported by IShellDispatch4, IShellDispatch5 adds a method that displays open windows in a 3D stack.

summary.para: Contains an object that represents an application.
This property is read-only.

remarks.para: This property is implemented and accessed through the Shell.EjectPC property.

The Application property returns the automation object supported by the application that contains the WebBrowser control, if that object is accessible. Otherwise, this property returns the WebBrowser control's automation object.
Use this property with the Set and CreateObject commands or with the GetObject command to create and manipulate an instance of the Windows Internet Explorer application.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch5.Parent

summary.para: Retrieves an object that represents the parent of the current object.
This property is read-only.

member.remarks: This property is implemented and accessed through the Shell.Parent property.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch5.NameSpace(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ShellFolderViewOptions)
member.summary: Creates and returns a Folder object for the specified folder.

param.name: vDir
param.para: The folder for which to create the Folder object. This can be a string that specifies the path of the folder or one of the ShellSpecialFolderConstants values. Note that the constant names found in ShellSpecialFolderConstants are available in Visual Basic, but not in VBScript or JScript. In those cases, the numeric values must be used in their place.

returns.para: Object reference to the Folder object for the specified folder. If the folder is not successfully created, this value returns null.
Object reference to the Folder object for the specified folder. If the folder is not successfully created, this value returns null.

member.remarks: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.NameSpace method.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch5.BrowseForFolder(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a dialog box that enables the user to select a folder and then returns the selected folder's Folder object.

param.name: Hwnd
param.para: The handle to the parent window of the dialog box. This value can be zero.

param.name: Title
param.para: A String value that represents the title displayed inside the Browse dialog box.

param.name: Options
param.para: An Integer value that contains the options for the method. This can be zero or a combination of the values listed under the ulFlags member of the BROWSEINFO structure.

param.name: RootFolder
param.para: The root folder to use in the dialog box. The user cannot browse higher in the tree than this folder. If this value is not specified, the root folder used in the dialog box is the desktop. This value can be a string that specifies the path of the folder or one of the ShellSpecialFolderConstants values. Note that the constant names found in ShellSpecialFolderConstants are available in Visual Basic, but not in VBScript or JScript. In those cases, the numeric values must be used in their place.

returns.para: An object reference to the selected folder's Folder object.
An object reference to the selected folder's Folder object.

member.remarks: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.BrowseForFolder method.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch6.IsRestricted(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a group's restriction setting from the registry.

param.name: sGroup
param.para: A String that contains the group name. This value is the name of a registry subkey under which to check for the restriction.

param.name: sRestriction
param.para: A String that contains the restriction whose value is to be retrieved.

returns.para: The value of the restriction. If the specified restriction is not found, the return value is 0.
The value of the restriction. If the specified restriction is not found, the return value is 0.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.IsRestricted method.
IsRestricted first looks for a subkey name that matches sGroup under the following key.

Restrictions are declared as values of the individual policy subkeys. If the restriction named in sRestriction is found in the subkey named in sGroup, IsRestricted returns the restriction's current value. If the restriction is not found under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, the same subkey is checked under HKEY_CURRENT_USER.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch6.ShellExecute(System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Performs a specified operation on a specified file.

param.name: sFile
param.para: A String that contains the name of the file on which ShellExecute will perform the action specified by vOperation.

param.name: vArguments
param.para: A string that contains parameter values for the operation.

param.name: vDirectory
param.para: The fully qualified path of the directory that contains the file specified by sFile. If this parameter is not specified, the current working directory is used.

param.name: vOperation
param.para: The operation to be performed. This value is set to one of the verb strings that is supported by the file. For a discussion of verbs, see the Remarks section. If this parameter is not specified, the default operation is performed.

param.name: vShow
param.para: A recommendation as to how the application window should be displayed initially. The application can ignore this recommendation. This parameter can be one of the following values. If this parameter is not specified, the application uses its default value.

item.term: Open the application with a hidden window.
Open the application with a normal window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position.
Open the application with a minimized window.
Open the application with a maximized window.
Open the application with its window at its most recent size and position. The active window remains active.
Open the application with its window at its current size and position.
Open the application with a minimized window. The active window remains active.
Open the application with its window in the default state specified by the application.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.ShellExecute method.

This method is equivalent to launching one of the commands associated with a file's shortcut menu. Each command is represented by a verb string. The set of supported verbs varies from file to file. The most commonly supported verb is "open", which is also usually the default verb. Other verbs might be supported by only certain types of files. For further discussion of Shell verbs, see Launching Applications or Extending Shortcut Menus.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch6.FindPrinter(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays the Find Printer dialog box.

param.name: Name
param.para: A String that contains the printer name.

param.name: location
param.para: A String that contains the printer location.

param.name: model
param.para: A String that contains the printer model.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.FindPrinter method.

If you assign strings to one or more of the optional parameters, they are displayed as default values in the associated edit control when the Find Printer dialog box is displayed. The user can either accept or override these values. If no value is assigned to a parameter, the associated edit box is empty and the user must enter a value.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellDispatch6.GetSystemInformation(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves system information.

param.name: sName
param.para: A String that specifies the system information that is being requested.

returns.para: Returns the value of the requested system information. The return type depends on which system information is requested. See the Remarks section for details.
Returns the value of the requested system information. The return type depends on which system information is requested. See the Remarks section for details.

remarks.para: This method is implemented and accessed through the Shell.GetSystemInformation method.
This method can be used to request many system information values. The following table gives the sName value that is used to request the information and the associated type of the returned value.
sName
Return type
Description
DirectoryServiceAvailable
Set to true if the directory service is available; otherwise, false.
DoubleClickTime
The double-click time, in milliseconds.
ProcessorLevel
Windows Vista and later. The processor level. Returns 3, 4, or 5, for x386, x486, and Pentium-level processors, respectively.
ProcessorSpeed
The processor speed, in megahertz (MHz).
ProcessorArchitecture
The processor architecture. For details, see the discussion of the wProcessorArchitecture member of the SYSTEM_INFO structure.
PhysicalMemoryInstalled
The amount of physical memory installed, in bytes.
The following are valid only on Windows XP.
IsOS_Professional
Set to true if the operating system is Windows XP Professional Edition; otherwise, false.
IsOS_Personal
Set to true if the operating system is Windows XP Home Edition; otherwise, false.
The following is valid only on Windows XP and later.
IsOS_DomainMember
Set to true if the computer is a member of a domain; otherwise, false.
This method is not currently available in Microsoft Visual Basic.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellFolderViewDual2

member.remarks: This interface also provides the methods of the IShellFolderViewDual interface, from which it inherits.

summary.para: Contains the object's Application object.
This property is read-only.

remarks.para: The Application property returns the automation object supported by the application that contains the WebBrowser control, if that object is accessible. Otherwise, this property returns the WebBrowser control's automation object.
Use this property with the Set and CreateObject commands or with the GetObject command to create and manipulate an instance of the Windows Internet Explorer application.
