member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellLinkDual
member.summary: Manages Shell links. This object makes much of the functionality of the IShellLink interface available to scripting applications.

summary.para: Gets or sets the path to the link object.
This property is read/write.
Gets or sets the description of the link.
This property is read/write.
Gets or sets the working directory specified in the link.
This property is read/write.
Contains a link's arguments.
This property is read/write.
Gets or sets the keyboard shortcut for the link.
This property is read/write.
Gets or sets the initial display state (sized, minimized, or maximized) of the link's command.
This property is read/write.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellLinkDual.Resolve(System.Int32)
member.summary: Looks for the target of a Shell link, even if the target has been moved or renamed.

param.name: fFlags
param.para: Flags that specify the action to be taken. This can be a combination of the following values:

list.item: (1)Do not display a dialog box if the link cannot be resolved. When this flag is set, the high-order word of fFlags specifies a time-out duration, in milliseconds. The method returns if the link cannot be resolved within the time-out duration. If the high-order word is set to zero, the time-out duration defaults to 3000 milliseconds (3 seconds).
(4)If the link has changed, update its path and list of identifiers.

(64)Disable distributed link tracking. By default, distributed link tracking tracks removable media across multiple devices based on the volume name. It also uses the UNC path to track remote file systems whose drive letter has changed. Setting this flag disables both types of tracking.

member.remarks: This method is essentially identical in functionality to Resolve. For further discussion of link resolution, see the Remarks section of that page.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellLinkDual.GetIconLocation(System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the location of the icon assigned to the link.
member.param: When this method returns, it holds the fully qualified path of the file that contains the icon.
member.returns: Returns the icon's index in the file specified by sPath.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellLinkDual.SetIconLocation(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the location of the icon assigned to the link.
member.param: The fully qualified path of the file that contains the icon.
The index of the icon in the file specified by sPath.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellLinkDual.Save(System.Object)
member.summary: Saves all changes to the link.

param.name: sFile
param.para: A string value that contains the fully qualified path of the file where the new link information is to be saved. If no file is specified, the current file is used.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IWebWizardHost
member.summary: Exposes methods that enable HTML pages which are hosted in a wizard extension to communicate with the wizard.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IWebWizardHost.FinalBack
member.summary: Navigates to the client-side page immediately preceding the page hosting the server-side HTML pages.
member.remarks: When the wizard displays the first server-side page and the user clicks the Back button, the server invokes FinalBack when notified of that event by the client's event handler.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IWebWizardHost.FinalNext
member.summary: Navigates to the client-side wizard page that follows the page that hosts the server-side HTML pages, or finishes the wizard if there are no further client-side pages.
member.remarks: When the wizard is displaying the last server-side HTML page and the user clicks the Next or Finish button, the server invokes FinalNext in that button's event handler.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IWebWizardHost.Cancel
member.summary: Simulates a Cancel button click.
member.remarks: The client is responsible for responding to this method with the expected behavior by closing the wizard.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IWebWizardHost.Caption
member.summary: This property is not implemented.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IWebWizardHost.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Sets or retrieves a property's current value.
member.value: The property value.
member.param: Name of the property.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IWebWizardHost.SetWizardButtons(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the Back, Next, and Finish buttons in the client's wizard frame.
member.param: Enables the Back button.
Enables the Next button.
Enables the Finish button. States that this is the last server-side page.
member.remarks: Be sure to implement handler functions in each server-side page for OnBack() and OnNext(), corresponding to the wizard buttons Back and Next. The OnBack() and OnNext() functions respond to SetWizardButtons. At the appropriate time, the OnNext() function calls SetWizardButtons with vbLastPage= true, which can enable a Finish button. OnNext() also calls FinalNext when a user clicks the Finish button.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IWebWizardHost.SetHeaderText(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the title and subtitle that appear in the wizard header. In general, the client will display the header above the HTML and below the title bar.
member.param: String containing the title.
String containing the subtitle.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID
member.summary: The FOLDERTYPEID values represent a view template applied to a folder, usually based on its intended use and contents.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_AccountPictures
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. The folder contains the image files used with the current user's account.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Communications

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_CompressedFolder
member.summary: The folder is a compressed archive, such as a compressed file with a .zip file name extension.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Contacts

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Documents
member.summary: The folder contains document files. These can be of mixed format.doc, .txt, and others.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Games

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Generic

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_GenericLibrary

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_GenericSearchResults
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder contains search results, but they are of mixed or no specific type.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Invalid
member.summary: The folder is invalid. There are several things that can cause this judgement: hard disk errors, file system errors, and compression errors among them.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Music
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder contains audio files, such as .mp3 and .wma files.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_NetworkExplorer

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_OpenSearch

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_OtherUsers
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Pictures
member.summary: Image files, such as .jpg, .tif, or .png files.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Printers
member.summary: Printers that have been added to the system. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_PublishedItems
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. A homegroup user's libraries.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_RecordedTV
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder contains recorded television broadcasts.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_RecycleBin
member.summary: The Recycle Bin. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_SavedGames
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder contains saved game states.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_SearchConnector
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_SearchHome
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Searches
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. A user's Searches folder, normally found at C:\Users\username\Searches.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_SoftwareExplorer

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_StartMenu

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_StorageProviderDocuments

member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8.1. The folder is a MSFT_StorageProvider folder and does not fall under one of the other FOLDERTYPEID categories.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_StorageProviderMusic

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.WM_USER
member.summary: The WM_USER constant is used by applications to help define private messages for use by private window classes, usually of the form WM_USER+X, where X is an integer value.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseCallbackProc
member.summary: Specifies an application-defined callback function used to send messages to, and process messages from, a Browse dialog box displayed in response to a call to SHBrowseForFolder.
member.param: The window handle of the browse dialog box.
The dialog box event that generated the message.

A value whose meaning depends on the event specified in uMsg as follows:
uMsg lParam
BFFM_INITIALIZED Not used, value is NULL.
BFFM_IUNKNOWN A pointer to an IUnknown interface.
BFFM_SELCHANGED A PIDL that identifies the newly selected item.
BFFM_VALIDATEFAILED A pointer to a string that contains the invalid name. An application can use this data in an error dialog informing the user that the name was not valid.
An application-defined value that was specified in the lParam member of the BROWSEINFO structure used in the call to SHBrowseForFolder.
member.returns: Returns zero except in the case of BFFM_VALIDATEFAILED. For that flag, returns zero to dismiss the dialog or nonzero to keep the dialog displayed.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseForFolderMessages
member.summary: Enumeration with dialog messages used by the SHBrowseForFolder dialog box.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag
member.summary: Flags enumeration to specify the dialog style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_RETURNONLYFSDIRS
member.summary: Only return file system directories. If the user selects folders that are not part of the file system, the OK button is grayed. The OK button remains enabled for "\\server" items, as well as "\\server\share" and directory items. However, if the user selects a "\\server" item, passing the PIDL returned by SHBrowseForFolder to SHGetPathFromIDList fails.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_DONTGOBELOWDOMAIN
member.summary: Do not include network folders below the domain level in the dialog box's tree view control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_STATUSTEXT
member.summary: Include a status area in the dialog box. The callback function can set the status text by sending messages to the dialog box. This flag is not supported when BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE is specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_RETURNFSANCESTORS
member.summary: Only return file system ancestors. An ancestor is a subfolder that is beneath the root folder in the namespace hierarchy. If the user selects an ancestor of the root folder that is not part of the file system, the OK button is grayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_EDITBOX
member.summary: Version 4.71. Include an edit control in the browse dialog box that allows the user to type the name of an item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_VALIDATE
member.summary: Version 4.71. If the user types an invalid name into the edit box, the browse dialog box calls the application's BrowseCallbackProc with the BFFM_VALIDATEFAILED message. This flag is ignored if BIF_EDITBOX is not specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE
member.summary: Version 5.0. Use the new user interface. Setting this flag provides the user with a larger dialog box that can be resized. The dialog box has several new capabilities, including: drag-and-drop capability within the dialog box, reordering, shortcut menus, new folders, delete, and other shortcut menu commands. If COM is initialized through CoInitializeEx with the COINIT_MULTITHREADED flag set, SHBrowseForFolder fails if BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE is passed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_USENEWUI
member.summary: Version 5.0. Use the new user interface, including an edit box. This flag is equivalent to BIF_EDITBOX | BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE. If COM is initialized through CoInitializeEx with the COINIT_MULTITHREADED flag set, SHBrowseForFolder fails if BIF_USENEWUI is passed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_BROWSEINCLUDEURLS
member.summary: Version 5.0. The browse dialog box can display URLs. The BIF_USENEWUI and BIF_BROWSEINCLUDEFILES flags must also be set. If any of these three flags are not set, the browser dialog box rejects URLs. Even when these flags are set, the browse dialog box displays URLs only if the folder that contains the selected item supports URLs. When the folder's IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf method is called to request the selected item's attributes, the folder must set the SFGAO_FOLDER attribute flag. Otherwise, the browse dialog box will not display the URL.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_UAHINT
member.summary: Version 6.0. When combined with BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE, adds a usage hint to the dialog box, in place of the edit box. BIF_EDITBOX overrides this flag.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_NONEWFOLDERBUTTON
member.summary: Version 6.0. Do not include the New Folder button in the browse dialog box.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_NOTRANSLATETARGETS
member.summary: Version 6.0. When the selected item is a shortcut, return the PIDL of the shortcut itself rather than its target.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_BROWSEFORCOMPUTER
member.summary: Only return computers. If the user selects anything other than a computer, the OK button is grayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_BROWSEFORPRINTER
member.summary:
Only allow the selection of printers. If the user selects anything other than a printer, the OK button is grayed.
In Windows XP and later systems, the best practice is to use a Windows XP-style dialog, setting the root of the dialog to the Printers and Faxes folder (CSIDL_PRINTERS).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_BROWSEINCLUDEFILES
member.summary: Version 4.71. The browse dialog box displays files as well as folders.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_SHAREABLE
member.summary: Version 5.0. The browse dialog box can display sharable resources on remote systems. This is intended for applications that want to expose remote shares on a local system. The BIF_NEWDIALOGSTYLE flag must also be set.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag.BIF_BROWSEFILEJUNCTIONS
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Allow folder junctions such as a library or a compressed file with a .zip file name extension to be browsed.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BROWSEINFO
member.summary: Contains parameters for the function and receives information about the folder selected by the user.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BROWSEINFO.hwndOwner
member.summary: A handle to the owner window for the dialog box.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BROWSEINFO.pidlRoot
member.summary: A PIDL that specifies the location of the root folder from which to start browsing. Only the specified folder and its subfolders in the namespace hierarchy appear in the dialog box. This member can be NULL; in that case, a default location is used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BROWSEINFO.pszDisplayName
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer to receive the display name of the folder selected by the user. The size of this buffer is assumed to be MAX_PATH characters.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BROWSEINFO.lpszTitle
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that is displayed above the tree view control in the dialog box. This string can be used to specify instructions to the user.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BROWSEINFO.ulFlags
member.summary: Flags that specify the options for the dialog box. This member can be 0 or a combination of the following values. Version numbers refer to the minimum version of Shell32.dll required for SHBrowseForFolder to recognize flags added in later releases.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BROWSEINFO.lpfn
member.summary: Pointer to an application-defined function that the dialog box calls when an event occurs. For more information, see the BrowseCallbackProc function. This member can be NULL.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BROWSEINFO.lParam
member.summary: An application-defined value that the dialog box passes to the callback function, if one is specified in .

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BROWSEINFO.iImage
member.summary: An integer value that receives the index of the image associated with the selected folder, stored in the system image list.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BROWSEINFO.#ctor(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,System.IntPtr,System.String,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseInfoFlag,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BrowseCallbackProc,Vanara.InteropServices.SafeCoTaskMemString)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

A PIDL that specifies the location of the root folder from which to start browsing.
The string that is displayed above the tree view control in the dialog box.
Flags that specify the options for the dialog box.
The callback function that the dialog box calls when an event occurs..
Buffer that receives the display name of the folder selected by the user.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.BROWSEINFO.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets the display name.
member.value: The display name.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IDO_SHGIOI_DEFAULT
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The overlay icon that indicates that the item is the default in a set. One example is the default printer.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IDO_SHGIOI_LINK
member.summary: The overlay icon that indicates a linked folder or file.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IDO_SHGIOI_SHARE
member.summary: The overlay icon that indicates a shared folder.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IDO_SHGIOI_SLOWFILE

summary.para: [ LPFNDFMCALLBACK is available for use in the operating systems specified in the Requirements section. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]
Defines the prototype for the callback function that receives messages from the Shell's default context menu implementation.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: The handle of the window that contains the view. This value can be NULL.

param.name: pdtobj
param.para: IDataObject that represents the selection the context menu is based on. This value can be NULL.

item.term: Sent by the default context menu implementation to allow LPFNDFMCALLBACK to add items to the menu.
Sent by the default context menu implementation to request LPFNDFMCALLBACK to invoke a menu command.
Sent by the default context menu implementation when the default menu command is being created, allowing an alternate choice to be made.

param.name: wParam
param.para: Additional information. See the individual notification pages for specific requirements.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Additional information. See the individual notification pages for specific requirements.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the message was handled, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

summary.para: [This interface is supported through Windows XP Service Pack 2 (SP2) and Windows Server 2003. It might be unsupported in subsequent versions of Windows.]
Defines the prototype for the callback function used by the system folder view object. This function essentially duplicates the functionality of IShellFolderViewCB.

param.name: psvOuter
param.para: A pointer to the owning instance of IShellView, if applicable. This parameter can be NULL.

param.name: hwndMain

param.name: wParam
param.para: Additional information dependent on the value in uMsg. See the individual notification pages for specific requirements.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Additional information dependent on the value in uMsg. See the individual notification pages for specific requirements.

returns.para: If this function pointer succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CLOSEPROPS
member.summary: A flag that controls how PifMgr_CloseProperties operates.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CLOSEPROPS.CLOSEPROPS_NONE
member.summary: No options specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CLOSEPROPS.CLOSEPROPS_DISCARD
member.summary: Abandon cached data.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL
member.summary: CSIDL (constant special item ID list) values provide a unique system-independent way to identify special folders used frequently by applications, but which may not have the same name or location on any given system. For example, the system folder may be "C:\Windows" on one system and "C:\Winnt" on another. These constants are defined in Shlobj.h.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_DESKTOP
member.summary: The virtual folder that represents the Windows desktop, the root of the namespace.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_INTERNET
member.summary: A virtual folder for Internet Explorer.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_PROGRAMS
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the user's program groups (which are themselves file system directories). A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu\Programs.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_CONTROLS
member.summary: The virtual folder that contains icons for the Control Panel applications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_PRINTERS
member.summary: The virtual folder that contains installed printers.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_PERSONAL
member.summary:
Version 6.0. The virtual folder that represents the My Documents desktop item. This is equivalent to CSIDL_MYDOCUMENTS.
Previous to Version 6.0. The file system directory used to physically store a user's common repository of documents. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents. This should be distinguished from the virtual My Documents folder in the namespace. To access that virtual folder, use SHGetFolderLocation, which returns the ITEMIDLIST for the virtual location, or refer to the technique described in Managing the File System.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_FAVORITES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for the user's favorite items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Favorites.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_STARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the user's Startup program group. The system starts these programs whenever the associated user logs on. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu\Programs\Startup.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_RECENT
member.summary: The file system directory that contains shortcuts to the user's most recently used documents. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Recent Documents. To create a shortcut in this folder, use SHAddToRecentDocs. In addition to creating the shortcut, this function updates the Shell's list of recent documents and adds the shortcut to the My Recent Documents submenu of the Start menu.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_SENDTO
member.summary: The file system directory that contains Send To menu items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\SendTo.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_BITBUCKET
member.summary: The virtual folder that contains the objects in the user's Recycle Bin.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_STARTMENU
member.summary: The file system directory that contains Start menu items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_MYDOCUMENTS
member.summary: Version 6.0. The virtual folder that represents the My Documents desktop item. This value is equivalent to CSIDL_PERSONAL.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_MYMUSIC
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for music files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\User\My Documents\My Music.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_MYVIDEO
member.summary: Version 6.0. The file system directory that serves as a common repository for video files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\My Videos.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_DESKTOPDIRECTORY
member.summary: The file system directory used to physically store file objects on the desktop (not to be confused with the desktop folder itself). A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Desktop.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_DRIVES
member.summary: The virtual folder that represents My Computer, containing everything on the local computer: storage devices, printers, and Control Panel. The folder can also contain mapped network drives.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_NETWORK
member.summary: A virtual folder that represents Network Neighborhood, the root of the network namespace hierarchy.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_NETHOOD
member.summary: A file system directory that contains the link objects that may exist in the My Network Places virtual folder. It is not the same as CSIDL_NETWORK, which represents the network namespace root. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\NetHood.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_FONTS
member.summary: A virtual folder that contains fonts. A typical path is C:\Windows\Fonts.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_TEMPLATES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for document templates. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Templates.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_STARTMENU
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the programs and folders that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_PROGRAMS
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the directories for the common program groups that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_STARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the programs that appear in the Startup folder for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs\Startup.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_DESKTOPDIRECTORY
member.summary: The file system directory that contains files and folders that appear on the desktop for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Desktop.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_APPDATA
member.summary: Version 4.71. The file system directory that serves as a common repository for application-specific data. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Application Data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_PRINTHOOD
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the link objects that can exist in the Printers virtual folder. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\PrintHood.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_LOCAL_APPDATA
member.summary: Version 5.0. The file system directory that serves as a data repository for local (nonroaming) applications. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Application Data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_ALTSTARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the user's nonlocalized Startup program group. This value is recognized in Windows Vista for backward compatibility, but the folder itself no longer exists.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_ALTSTARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the nonlocalized Startup program group for all users. This value is recognized in Windows Vista for backward compatibility, but the folder itself no longer exists.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_FAVORITES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for favorite items common to all users.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_INTERNET_CACHE
member.summary: Version 4.72. The file system directory that serves as a common repository for temporary Internet files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Temporary Internet Files.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COOKIES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet cookies. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Cookies.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_HISTORY
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet history items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_APPDATA
member.summary: Version 5.0. The file system directory that contains application data for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application Data. This folder is used for application data that is not user specific. For example, an application can store a spell-check dictionary, a database of clip art, or a log file in the CSIDL_COMMON_APPDATA folder. This information will not roam and is available to anyone using the computer.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_WINDOWS
member.summary: Version 5.0. The Windows directory or SYSROOT. This corresponds to the %windir% or %SYSTEMROOT% environment variables. A typical path is C:\Windows.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_SYSTEM
member.summary: Version 5.0. The Windows System folder. A typical path is C:\Windows\System32.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_PROGRAM_FILES
member.summary: Version 5.0. The Program Files folder. A typical path is C:\Program Files.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_MYPICTURES
member.summary: Version 5.0. The file system directory that serves as a common repository for image files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\My Pictures.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_PROFILE
member.summary: Version 5.0. The user's profile folder. A typical path is C:\Users\username. Applications should not create files or folders at this level; they should put their data under the locations referred to by CSIDL_APPDATA or CSIDL_LOCAL_APPDATA. However, if you are creating a new Known Folder the profile root referred to by CSIDL_PROFILE is appropriate.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_PROGRAM_FILES_COMMON
member.summary: Version 5.0. A folder for components that are shared across applications. A typical path is C:\Program Files\Common. Valid only for Windows XP.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_TEMPLATES
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the templates that are available to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Templates.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_DOCUMENTS
member.summary: The file system directory that contains documents that are common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_ADMINTOOLS
member.summary: Version 5.0. The file system directory that contains administrative tools for all users of the computer.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_ADMINTOOLS
member.summary: Version 5.0. The file system directory that is used to store administrative tools for an individual user. The MMC will save customized consoles to this directory, and it will roam with the user.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_CONNECTIONS
member.summary: The virtual folder that represents Network Connections, that contains network and dial-up connections.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_MUSIC
member.summary: Version 6.0. The file system directory that serves as a repository for music files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Music.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_PICTURES
member.summary: Version 6.0. The file system directory that serves as a repository for image files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Pictures.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_VIDEO
member.summary: Version 6.0. The file system directory that serves as a repository for video files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Videos.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_RESOURCES
member.summary: Windows Vista. The file system directory that contains resource data. A typical path is C:\Windows\Resources.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_OEM_LINKS
member.summary: This value is recognized in Windows Vista for backward compatibility, but the folder itself is no longer used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_CDBURN_AREA
member.summary: Version 6.0. The file system directory that acts as a staging area for files waiting to be written to a CD. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Application Data\Microsoft\CD Burning.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMPUTERSNEARME
member.summary: The folder that represents other computers in your workgroup.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FCS
member.summary: A flag that controls the action of SHGetSetFolderCustomSettings.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FCS.FCS_READ
member.summary: Retrieve the custom folder settings in pfcs.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FCS.FCS_FORCEWRITE
member.summary: Use pfcs to set the custom folder's settings regardless of whether the values are already present.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FCS.FCS_WRITE
member.summary: Use pfcs to set the custom folder's settings if the values are not already present.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERCUSTOMSETTINGSMASK
member.summary: Flags used by SHFOLDERCUSTOMSETTINGS.dwMask.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERCUSTOMSETTINGSMASK.FCSM_VIEWID
member.summary: Deprecated. pvid contains the folder's GUID.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERCUSTOMSETTINGSMASK.FCSM_WEBVIEWTEMPLATE
member.summary: Deprecated. pszWebViewTemplate contains a pointer to a buffer containing the path to the folder's WebView template.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERCUSTOMSETTINGSMASK.FCSM_INFOTIP
member.summary: pszInfoTip contains a pointer to a buffer containing the folder's info tip.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERCUSTOMSETTINGSMASK.FCSM_CLSID
member.summary: pclsid contains the folder's CLSID.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERCUSTOMSETTINGSMASK.FCSM_ICONFILE
member.summary: pszIconFile contains the path to the file containing the folder's icon.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERCUSTOMSETTINGSMASK.FCSM_LOGO
member.summary: pszLogo contains the path to the file containing the folder's thumbnail icon.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.FOLDERCUSTOMSETTINGSMASK.FCSM_FLAGS
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.GPFIDL_FLAGS
member.summary: Flags used by SHGetPathFromIDListEx.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.GPFIDL_FLAGS.GPFIDL_DEFAULT
member.summary: Win32 file names, servers, and root drives are included.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.GPFIDL_FLAGS.GPFIDL_ALTNAME
member.summary: Uses short file names.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.GPFIDL_FLAGS.GPFIDL_UNCPRINTER
member.summary: Include UNC printer names items.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.MM
member.summary: Flags used by Shell_MergeMenus.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.MM.MM_ADDSEPARATOR
member.summary: Add a separator between the items from the two menus if one does not exist already. If you are inserting the entries from hmSrc into the middle of hmDst, a separator is added above and below the hmSrc material.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.MM.MM_SUBMENUSHAVEIDS
member.summary: Do not remove any existing separators in the two menus. Note that this could result in two separators in a row.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.MM.MM_DONTREMOVESEPS
member.summary: Set this flag if the submenus have IDs which should be adjusted.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OFASI
member.summary: Used for options in SHOpenFolderAndSelectItems.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OFASI.OFASI_NONE
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OFASI.OFASI_EDIT
member.summary: Select an item and put its name in edit mode. This flag can only be used when a single item is being selected. For multiple item selections, it is ignored.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OFASI.OFASI_OPENDESKTOP
member.summary: Select the item or items on the desktop rather than in a Windows Explorer window. Note that if the desktop is obscured behind open windows, it will not be made visible.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OPEN_AS_INFO_FLAGS
member.summary: The characteristics of the SHOpenWithDialog dialog box.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OPEN_AS_INFO_FLAGS.OAIF_ALLOW_REGISTRATION
member.summary: Enable the "always use this program" checkbox. If not passed, it will be disabled.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OPEN_AS_INFO_FLAGS.OAIF_REGISTER_EXT
member.summary: Do the registration after the user hits the OK button.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OPEN_AS_INFO_FLAGS.OAIF_EXEC
member.summary: Execute file after registering.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OPEN_AS_INFO_FLAGS.OAIF_FORCE_REGISTRATION
member.summary: Force the Always use this program checkbox to be checked. Typically, you won't use the OAIF_ALLOW_REGISTRATION flag when you pass this value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OPEN_AS_INFO_FLAGS.OAIF_HIDE_REGISTRATION
member.summary: Introduced in Windows Vista. Hide the Always use this program checkbox. If this flag is specified, the OAIF_ALLOW_REGISTRATION and OAIF_FORCE_REGISTRATION flags will be ignored.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OPEN_AS_INFO_FLAGS.OAIF_URL_PROTOCOL
member.summary: Introduced in Windows Vista. The value for the extension that is passed is actually a protocol, so the Open With dialog box should show applications that are registered as capable of handling that protocol.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OPEN_AS_INFO_FLAGS.OAIF_FILE_IS_URI
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. The location pointed to by the parameter is given as a URI.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OPENPROPS
member.summary: A flag that controls how PifMgr_OpenProperties operates.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OPENPROPS.OPENPROPS_NONE
member.summary: No options specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.OPENPROPS.OPENPROPS_INHIBITPIF
member.summary: Ignore any existing .pif files and get the properties from win.ini or _Default.pif. This flag is ignored on Windows NT, Windows 2000, and Windows XP.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PCS
member.summary: Return values for PathCleanupSpec.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PCS.PCS_FATAL
member.summary: The cleaned path is not a valid file name. This flag is always returned in conjunction with PCS_PATHTOOLONG.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PCS.PCS_REPLACEDCHAR
member.summary: Replaced one or more invalid characters.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PCS.PCS_REMOVEDCHAR
member.summary: Removed one or more invalid characters.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PCS.PCS_TRUNCATED
member.summary: The returned path is truncated.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PCS.PCS_PATHTOOLONG
member.summary: The function failed because the input path specified at is too long to allow the formation of a valid file name from . When this flag is returned, it is always accompanied by the PCS_FATAL flag.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PRF
member.summary: Flags for PathResolve.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PRF.PRF_VERIFYEXISTS
member.summary: Return TRUE if the file's existence is verified; otherwise FALSE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PRF.PRF_TRYPROGRAMEXTENSIONS
member.summary: Look for the specified path with the following extensions appended: .pif, .com, .bat, .cmd, .lnk, and .exe.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PRF.PRF_FIRSTDIRDEF
member.summary: Look first in the directory or directories specified by dirs.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PRF.PRF_DONTFINDLNK
member.summary: Ignore .lnk files.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PRF.PRF_REQUIREABSOLUTE
member.summary: Require an absolute (full) path.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.QITIP
member.summary: Flags that direct the handling of the item from which you're retrieving the info tip text. This value is commonly zero (QITIPF_DEFAULT).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.QITIP.QITIPF_DEFAULT
member.summary: No special handling.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.QITIP.QITIPF_USENAME
member.summary: Provide the name of the item in ppwszTip rather than the info tip text.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.QITIP.QITIPF_LINKNOTARGET
member.summary: If the item is a shortcut, retrieve the info tip text of the shortcut rather than its target.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.QITIP.QITIPF_LINKUSETARGET
member.summary: If the item is a shortcut, retrieve the info tip text of the shortcut's target.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.QITIP.QITIPF_USESLOWTIP
member.summary: Search the entire namespace for the information. This value can result in a delayed response time.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.QITIP.QITIPF_SINGLELINE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Put the info tip on a single line.

summary.para: These flags are used with the SHRestricted function. SHRestricted is used to determine whether a specified administrator policy is in effect. In many cases, applications need to modify certain behaviors in order to comply with the policies enacted by system administrators.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NONE
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NORUN
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has forbidden access to the Run command on the Start menu. Applications should remove similar functionality. For example, a browser with an address bar should deny attempts by the user to type the path of a local file into the address bar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCLOSE
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has forbidden access to the Shut Down command on the Start menu. Applications should remove the ability to shut down or restart the computer.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSAVESET
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has requested that applications do not save their state at exit for restoration the next time they are run. Applications should disable saving their window position and settings.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOFILEMENU
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has forbidden access to the Windows Explorer File menu. Applications should remove similar functionality.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSETFOLDERS
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has forbidden access to Control Panel, Printers, and Network and Dial up Connections. Applications should prevent users from viewing those folders.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSETTASKBAR
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has forbidden access to taskbar settings. Applications should prevent users from changing those settings.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NODESKTOP
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has specified that all icons on the desktop should be hidden. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOFIND
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has indicated that the user should not be enabled to search for files. Applications should remove similar functionality.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NODRIVES
member.summary: A 32-bit value that specifies the drives that should not be displayed to the user. Bit 0 corresponds to drive A, up to bit 25 which corresponds to drive Z. Applications that display a list of drives should remove drives that have their corresponding bits set.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NODRIVEAUTORUN
member.summary: A 32-bit value that specifies the drives for which AutoRun should be disabled. Bit 0 corresponds to drive A, up to bit 25 which corresponds to drive Z. Applications should not offer to AutoRun any drive that has its corresponding bit set.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NODRIVETYPEAUTORUN
member.summary: A 32-bit value that specifies the drive types for which AutoRun should be disabled. The bits are numbered according to the return value of GetDriveType. For example, bit DRIVE_CDROM disables AutoRun on CD-ROM drives. Applications should not offer to AutoRun any drive whose type has its corresponding bit set.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NONETHOOD
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has removed Network Neighborhood (also known as My Network Places) from the Shell namespace. Applications should disable functionality that enables the user to browse the network.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_STARTBANNER
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_RESTRICTRUN
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has restricted the programs the user can run. Only programs listed under the registry key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer can be run either from the Run dialog box, by double-clicking, or by selecting from the File menu. Applications should prevent users from running programs not listed under that key. Applications that use the ShellExecute or ShellExecuteEx functions to run programs do not need to take any special action because those functions check the policy.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOPRINTERTABS
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOPRINTERDELETE
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the user's ability to delete printers. Applications should remove the ability to delete printers.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOPRINTERADD
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the user's ability to add printers. Applications should remove the ability to add printers.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSTARTMENUSUBFOLDERS
member.summary: If nonzero, subfolders of the Start menu and Programs menu are not shown on the top of the classic Start menu, the Programs list on the classic Start menu, or the All Programs list on the Start menu. Applications that enumerate the contents of the Start menu should avoid subfolders. If nonzero, this flag does not restrict any menus other than those listed here; in particular, My Computer can still expand.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_MYDOCSONNET
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOEXITTODOS
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_ENFORCESHELLEXTSECURITY
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has forbidden the use of unapproved Shell extensions. Applications should not instantiate Shell extensions unless they are marked as approved by the system administrator. For more information, see Creating Shell Extension Handlers.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_LINKRESOLVEIGNORELINKINFO
member.summary: If nonzero, the system does not attempt to reconnect mapped network drives when resolving a broken shortcut to a file or folder on a mapped network drive. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCOMMONGROUPS
member.summary: If nonzero, indicates the system administrator has forbidden access to the CSIDL_COMMON_STARTMENU or CSIDL_COMMON_PROGRAMS folders on the Start menu. Applications that enumerate the contents of the Start menu should avoid those folders.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_SEPARATEDESKTOPPROCESS
member.summary: If nonzero, the administrator has required that folders be opened in a separate process. This overrides and disables the corresponding setting in the Folder Options dialog box. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOWEB
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has removed the Web tab from the desktop Properties dialog box. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows XP and later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOTRAYCONTEXTMENU
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has forbidden access to context menus for the taskbar. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOVIEWCONTEXTMENU
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has forbidden access to context menus for Shell objects. Applications should disable context menus for Shell objects.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NONETCONNECTDISCONNECT
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has denied users the ability to map or disconnect network drives. Applications should remove the ability to map or disconnect network drives.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_STARTMENULOGOFF
member.summary: If 1, the system administrator has removed the Log Off option from the Start menu. If 2, the system administrator has forced the Log Off option to be shown. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSETTINGSASSIST
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOINTERNETICON
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has removed the Internet Explorer icon from the desktop. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NORECENTDOCSHISTORY
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled recent document history. Applications must disable all MRU lists, such as those that are often displayed on the File menu. Adherence to this setting is mandatory for Windows logo compliance.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NORECENTDOCSMENU
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has removed the Recent Documents menu from the Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOACTIVEDESKTOP
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to create web content on the desktop. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOACTIVEDESKTOPCHANGES
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to change web content on the desktop. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOFAVORITESMENU
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has removed the Favorites menu from the Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_CLEARRECENTDOCSONEXIT
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has required that recent document history and related history information be deleted when the user logs off. Applications should erase recent document history when they exit.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_CLASSICSHELL
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCUSTOMIZEWEBVIEW
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to customize the appearance of Windows Explorer folders. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOHTMLWALLPAPER
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to set the wallpaper to any image that is not a bitmap (*.bmp) image. Applications that enable the user to change desktop wallpaper should disable web content. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCHANGINGWALLPAPER
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to change the desktop wallpaper. Applications should disable corresponding functionality.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NODESKCOMP
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled desktop components. Applications that create or modify desktop components should disable this functionality. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOADDDESKCOMP
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to create desktop components. Applications that create desktop components should disable this functionality.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NODELDESKCOMP
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to delete desktop components. Applications that delete desktop components should disable this functionality. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCLOSEDESKCOMP
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to close desktop components. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCLOSE_DRAGDROPBAND
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to drag, drop, or close desktop bands. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOMOVINGBAND
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to move a desktop band. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOEDITDESKCOMP
member.summary: If nonzero, indicates the system administrator has disabled the ability to modify desktop components. Applications that modify desktop components should disable this functionality. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NORESOLVESEARCH
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled heuristic file searching when resolving broken shortcuts. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NORESOLVETRACK
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the use of the link tracking service when resolving broken shortcuts. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_FORCECOPYACLWITHFILE
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has forced Shell file copy operations to copy the ACL with the file rather than inheriting the ACL from the target folder. Applications that use the SHFileOperation function do not need to perform any special actions. Applications that copy files manually should ensure that the source ACL is copied.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOLOGO3CHANNELNOTIFY
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled channel updates when resolving shortcuts. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not supported.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOFORGETSOFTWAREUPDATE
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to uncheck the Remind me until I update the current version checkbox in the SoftwareUpdateMessageBox function. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSETACTIVEDESKTOP
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to change settings for web content on the desktop. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOUPDATEWINDOWS
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has hidden the Windows Update shortcut on the Start menu. Applications that enumerate the contents of the Start menu should not show the Windows Update shortcut to the user.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCHANGESTARMENU
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to make changes to the Start menu. Applications should disable any feature that enables the user to reorganize their Start menu.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOFOLDEROPTIONS
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has denied access to the Folder Options dialog box. Applications that display Folder Options in Control Panel should disable this functionality.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_HASFINDCOMPUTERS
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to search for computers on the network. Applications should remove the ability to search for computers on the network.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_INTELLIMENUS
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled personalized menus. Applications should not hide infrequently-used menu commands.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_RUNDLGMEMCHECKBOX
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the Run in separate memory space option in the Run dialog. Applications that provide similar functionality should remove the corresponding checkbox.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_ARP_ShowPostSetup
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has removed the list of incomplete setup operations from the "Add/Remove Windows Components" section of the Add/Remove Programs dialog box. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCSC
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has removed Synchronize All from the Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCONTROLPANEL
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has denied access to Control Panel. Applications should disable any functionality that runs .

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_ENUMWORKGROUP
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has indicated that the Network Neighborhood should include the computer workgroup. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_ARP_NOARP
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has denied access to the Add/Remove Programs dialog box. Applications should disable any functionality that runs the Add/Remove Programs dialog box. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_ARP_NOREMOVEPAGE
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has denied access to the Change or Remove Programs section of the Add/Remove Programs dialog box. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_ARP_NOADDPAGE
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has denied access to the Add Programs section of the Add/Remove Programs dialog box. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_ARP_NOWINSETUPPAGE
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has denied access to the Add/Remove Windows Components section of the Add/Remove Programs dialog box. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_GREYMSIADS
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has specified that Windows Installer shortcuts that refer to applications that are available but not yet installed should be displayed on the Start menu in gray. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCHANGEMAPPEDDRIVELABEL
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCHANGEMAPPEDDRIVECOMMENT
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_MaxRecentDocs
member.summary: A 32-bit value that specifies the maximum number of documents to be retained in the Recent Documents menu. If this value is zero, then the system administrator has not specified any maximum, and applications can choose a default. If this value is nonzero, applications should restrict their Recent Documents list to the specified number of items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NONETWORKCONNECTIONS
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has removed the Network Connections menu from the Start menu. Applications should hide lists of network and dial-up connections.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_FORCESTARTMENULOGOFF
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has forced the Log Off command onto the Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOWEBVIEW
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled folder HTML templates (Windows 2000) or folder tasks (Windows XP) in Windows Explorer. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCUSTOMIZETHISFOLDER
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to customize the appearance of Windows Explorer folders. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOENCRYPTION
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to encrypt and decrypt files and folders. Applications should not call EncryptFile or DecryptFile.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_DONTSHOWSUPERHIDDEN
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to view files marked System and Hidden ("super-hidden files"), overriding the fShowSuperHidden member of the SHELLSTATE structure. Applications should not show files that have both the FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SYSTEM and FILE_ATTRIBUTE_HIDDEN attributes to the user.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSHELLSEARCHBUTTON
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the Search button in the Windows Explorer toolbar. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOHARDWARETAB
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the Hardware tab in the Drive, Mouse, Keyboard, and Multimedia property sheets. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NORUNASINSTALLPROMPT
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the automatic prompt for automatic credentials when installing an application. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_PROMPTRUNASINSTALLNETPATH
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the automatic prompt for automatic credentials when installing an application from a network path. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOMANAGEMYCOMPUTERVERB
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has removed the Manage command from the My Computer context menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_DISALLOWRUN
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has restricted the programs the user can run. Programs listed under the registry key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\DisallowRun may not be run from the Run dialog box, by double-clicking, or by selecting from the File menu. Programs are listed by their full path (for example, "C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe"). Applications should prevent users from running programs listed under that key. Applications that use the ShellExecute or ShellExecuteEx function to run programs do not need to take any special action because those functions will check the policy.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOWELCOMESCREEN
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the Welcome to Windows program that is run when a user logs on. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_RESTRICTCPL
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has restricted the control panel applications the user can run. In order to be run, a control panel application must be listed under the registry key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\RestrictCpl . The control panel application can be listed either under its display name (for example, "Mouse") or under its filename (for example, "main.cpl"). Applications that launch control panel applications should prevent users from running control panel applications not listed under that key.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_DISALLOWCPL
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has restricted the control panel applications the user can run. In order to be run, a control panel application must not be listed under the registry key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\DisallowCpl . The control panel application can be listed either under its display name (for example, "Mouse") or under its filename (for example, "main.cpl"). Applications that launch control panel applications should prevent users from running control panel applications listed under that key.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSMBALLOONTIP
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled balloon tips that are displayed by the Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSMHELP
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has removed the Help option from the Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOWINKEYS
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the keyboard shortcut associated with the Windows logo key. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOENCRYPTONMOVE
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has specified that unencrypted files and folders moved into an encrypted folder should remain unencrypted instead of inheriting the encryption attribute from the enclosing folder. Applications that move files and folders should unencrypt them if they were originally unencrypted and are moved into an encrypted folder. Applications that use the SHFileOperation function to move files do not need to perform any special actions because the SHFileOperation function respects this policy.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOLOCALMACHINERUN
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the execution of programs listed in the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run registry key. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCURRENTUSERRUN
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the execution of programs listed in the HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run registry key. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOLOCALMACHINERUNONCE
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the execution of programs listed in the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce registry key. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCURRENTUSERRUNONCE
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the execution of programs listed in the HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce registry key. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_FORCEACTIVEDESKTOPON
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has forced web content to be enabled on the desktop. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOVIEWONDRIVE
member.summary: A 32-bit value that specifies the drives the user cannot open or drop files into. Bit 0 corresponds to drive A, up to bit 25 which corresponds to drive Z. Applications that enable the user to open folders or drop files should prevent the user from opening a folder on a restricted drive or dropping files onto a restricted drive.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NONETCRAWL
member.summary: Windows XP, Windows2003, or IE_BACKCOMPAT_VERSION defined. If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled automatic searching for network folders and printers, overriding the member of the SHELLSTATE structure. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSHAREDDOCUMENTS
member.summary: Windows XP, Windows2003 or IE_BACKCOMPAT_VERSION defined. If nonzero, the system administrator has hidden the Shared Documents icon in My Computer. Applications should hide access to CSIDL_COMMON_DOCUMENTS. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSMMYDOCS
member.summary: If nonzero, the system administrator has hidden the My Documents icon on the Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSMMYPICS
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has hidden the My Pictures icon on the Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_ALLOWBITBUCKDRIVES
member.summary: Windows XP or later. A 32-bit value that specifies the drives for which the Recycle Bin should be forced to be enabled. The system typically disables the Recycle Bin on drives that are not local fixed drives. Bit 0 corresponds to drive A, up to bit 25 which corresponds to drive Z. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NONLEGACYSHELLMODE
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has hidden the Back and Forward buttons in the Internet Explorer toolbar. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCONTROLPANELBARRICADE
member.summary: Windows XP or later. Ignored.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSTARTPAGE
member.summary: Windows XP or later. Ignored.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOAUTOTRAYNOTIFY
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has forced all taskbar icons to be visible, even if they are inactive, overriding the user's decision to hide inactive taskbar icons. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOTASKGROUPING
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled grouping of similar taskbar buttons, overriding the user's decision to enable taskbar button grouping. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCDBURNING
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled CD burning. Applications should disable any CD-burning capabilities.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_MYCOMPNOPROP
member.summary: Windows 2000 SP3 or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the System Properties dialog box. Applications should not launch the System Properties dialog box.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_MYDOCSNOPROP
member.summary: Windows 2000 SP3 or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to view properties of the My Documents folder. Applications should not redirect the My Documents folder.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSTARTPANEL
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the Windows XP Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NODISPLAYAPPEARANCEPAGE
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If 1, the system administrator has disabled the Themes and Appearance pages from the Desktop Properties dialog box. Applications should not change system colors and appearance.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOTHEMESTAB
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the Themes page from the Desktop Properties dialog. Applications should not change visual styles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOVISUALSTYLECHOICE
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to change visual styles. Applications should not change visual styles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSIZECHOICE
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to change font sizes from the Appearance page on the Desktop Properties dialog box. Applications should not change system metrics.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOCOLORCHOICE
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has disabled the ability to change system colors from the Appearance page on the Desktop Properties dialog box. Applications should not change system colors.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_SETVISUALSTYLE
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has forced a specific visual style. Applications should not change visual styles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_STARTRUNNOHOMEPATH
member.summary: Windows 2000 SP3 or later. If nonzero, the default working directory for programs run from the Run dialog is not forced to the user's home directory. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOUSERNAMEINSTARTPANEL
member.summary: Windows XP, Windows 2003. If nonzero, the system administrator has hidden the user name on the Windows XP Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions. Windows Vista or later: Not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOMYCOMPUTERICON
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has hidden the My Computer icon. Applications should not permit access to the My Computer icon.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSMNETWORKPLACES
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has hidden the Network Places icon on the Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSMPINNEDLIST
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has hidden the list of "pinned" items on the Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSMMYMUSIC
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has hidden the My Music icon on the Start menu. Applications do not need to perform any special actions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.RESTRICTIONS.REST_NOSMEJECTPC
member.summary: Windows XP or later. If nonzero, the system administrator has hidden the Eject command on the Start menu. Applications should not enable the user to eject the computer.
