member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCFOLDERCAPABILITIES
member.summary: Specifies the state of a tree item. These values are used by methods of the INameSpaceTreeControlFolderCapabilities interface.
member.remarks: The NSTCFOLDERCAPABILITIES type is defined in Shobjidl.h beginning in Windows 7.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCFOLDERCAPABILITIES.NSTCFC_NONE
member.summary: The property does not exist. Filtering is not supported.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCFOLDERCAPABILITIES.NSTCFC_PINNEDITEMFILTERING
member.summary: Property exists. Supports filtering based on the value specified in System.IsPinnedToNameSpaceTree.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCFOLDERCAPABILITIES.NSTCFC_DELAY_REGISTER_NOTIFY
member.summary: Delays registration for change notifications until the tree is expanded in the navigation pane.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCGNI
member.summary: The type of the next item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCGNI.NSTCGNI_NEXT
member.summary: The next sibling of the given item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCGNI.NSTCGNI_NEXTVISIBLE
member.summary: The next visible item in the tree that has any relationship to the given item. This includes a child (if there is one), the next sibling, or even one of the ancestor's siblings.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCGNI.NSTCGNI_PREV
member.summary: The previous sibling item of the given item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCGNI.NSTCGNI_PREVVISIBLE
member.summary: The previous visible item that is a sibling item, sibling descendent item or a parent item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCGNI.NSTCGNI_PARENT
member.summary: The parent item of the given item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCGNI.NSTCGNI_CHILD
member.summary: The first child item of the given item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCGNI.NSTCGNI_FIRSTVISIBLE
member.summary: The absolute first visible item in the tree (not relative to the given item).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCGNI.NSTCGNI_LASTVISIBLE
member.summary: The absolute last visible item in the tree (not relative to the given item).

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCITEMSTATE
member.summary: Specifies the state of a tree item. These values are used by methods of the INameSpaceTreeControl interface.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCITEMSTATE.NSTCIS_NONE
member.summary: The item has default state; it is not selected, expanded, bolded or disabled.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCITEMSTATE.NSTCIS_SELECTED
member.summary: The item is selected.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCITEMSTATE.NSTCIS_EXPANDED
member.summary: The item is expanded.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCITEMSTATE.NSTCIS_BOLD
member.summary: The item is bold.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCITEMSTATE.NSTCIS_DISABLED
member.summary: The item is disabled.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCITEMSTATE.NSTCIS_SELECTEDNOEXPAND
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The item is selected, but not expanded.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCROOTSTYLE
member.summary: Specifies the style of the root that is being appended.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCROOTSTYLE.NSTCRS_VISIBLE
member.summary: The root is visible as well as the items. Mutually exclusive with NSTCRS_HIDDEN.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCROOTSTYLE.NSTCRS_HIDDEN
member.summary: The root is hidden so that the children only are visible. Mutually exclusive with NSTCRS_VISIBLE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCROOTSTYLE.NSTCRS_EXPANDED
member.summary: The root is expanded upon initialization.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE
member.summary: Describes the characteristics of a given namespace tree control.

remarks.para: Three values have effect only in conjunction with NSTCS_CHECKBOXES: NSTCS_PARTIALCHECKBOXES, NSTCS_EXCLUSIONCHECKBOXES, and NSTCS_DIMMEDCHECKBOXES. The icons associated with these states are inserted into the state image list as follows:

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_HASEXPANDOS
member.summary: The control displays a triangleknown as an expandoon the leftmost edge of those items that have child items. Clicking on the expando expands the item to reveal the children of the item. Has no effect when combined with NSTCS_SHOWTABSBUTTON, NSTCS_SHOWDELETEBUTTON, or NSTCS_SHOWREFRESHBUTTON. Maps to the TVS_HASBUTTONS tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_HASLINES
member.summary: The control draws lines to the left of the tree items that lead to their individual parent items. Has no effect when combined with NSTCS_SHOWTABSBUTTON, NSTCS_SHOWDELETEBUTTON, or NSTCS_SHOWREFRESHBUTTON. Maps to the TVS_HASLINES tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_SINGLECLICKEXPAND
member.summary: An item expands to show its child items in response to a single mouse click. Maps to the TVS_SINGLEEXPAND tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_FULLROWSELECT
member.summary: The selection of an item fills the row with inverse text to the end of the window area, regardless of the length of the text. When this option is not declared, only the area behind text is inverted. This value cannot be combined with NSTCS_HASLINES. Maps to the TVS_FULLROWSELECT tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_SPRINGEXPAND
member.summary: When one item is selected and expanded and you select a second item, the first selection automatically collapses. This is the opposite of the TVS_EX_NOSINGLECOLLAPSE tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_HORIZONTALSCROLL
member.summary: The area of the window that contains the tree of namespace items has a horizontal scroll bar. Maps to the WS_HSCROLL Windows style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_ROOTHASEXPANDO
member.summary: The root item is preceded by an expando that allows expansion of the root item. Maps to the TVS_LINESATROOT tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_SHOWSELECTIONALWAYS
member.summary: The node of an item is outlined when the control does not have the focus. Maps to the TVS_SHOWSELALWAYS tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_NOINFOTIP
member.summary: Do not display infotips when the mouse cursor is over an item. This is the opposite of the TVS_INFOTIP tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_EVENHEIGHT
member.summary: Sets the height of the items to an even height. By default, the height of items can be even or odd. This is the opposite of the TVS_NONEVENHEIGHT tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_NOREPLACEOPEN
member.summary: Do not replace the Open command in the shortcut menu with a user-defined function.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_DISABLEDRAGDROP
member.summary: Do not allow drag-and-drop operations within the control. Note that you can still drag an item from outside of the control and drop it onto the control. Maps to the TVS_DISABLEDRAGDROP tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_NOORDERSTREAM
member.summary: Do not persist reordering changes. Used with NSTCS_FAVORITESMODE. If favorites mode is not specified, this flag has no effect.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_RICHTOOLTIP
member.summary: Use a rich tooltip. Rich tooltips display the item's icon in addition to the item's text. A standard tooltip displays only the item's text. The tree view displays tooltips only for items in the tree that are partially visible. Maps to the TVS_EX_RICHTOOLTIP tree view control style.NSTCS_RICHTOOLTIP has no effect unless it is combined with NSTCS_NOINFOTIP and/or NSTCS_FAVORITESMODE. If NSTCS_NOINFOTIP is not specified, the tree view displays an infotip instead of a tooltip. If NSTCS_FAVORITESMODE is not specified, the namespace tree control always sets the TVS_EX_RICHTOOLTIP style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_BORDER
member.summary: Draw a thin border around the control. Corresponds to WS_BORDER.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_NOEDITLABELS
member.summary: Do not allow creation of an in-place edit box, which would allow the user to rename the given item. This is the opposite of the TVS_EDITLABELS tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_TABSTOP
member.summary: If the control is hosted, you can tabstop into the control. Corresponds to WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_FAVORITESMODE
member.summary: The control has the appearance of the favorites band in Windows XP.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_AUTOHSCROLL
member.summary: When you hover the mouse pointer over an item that extends past the end of the control window, the control automatically scrolls horizontally so that the item appears more fully in the window area. Maps to the TVS_EX_AUTOHSCROLL tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_FADEINOUTEXPANDOS
member.summary: If the control does not have the focus and there are items that are preceded by expandos, then these expandos are visible only when the mouse pointer is near to the control. Maps to the TVS_EX_FADEINOUTEXPANDOS tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_EMPTYTEXT
member.summary: If an item has no children and is not expanded, then that item contains a line of text at the child level that says "empty".

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_CHECKBOXES
member.summary: Items have check boxes on their leftmost side. These check boxes can be of types partial, exclusion or dimmed, which correspond to the flags NSTCS_PARTIALCHECKBOXES, NSTCS_EXCLUSIONCHECKBOXES, and NSTCS_DIMMEDCHECKBOXES. Maps to the TVS_CHECKBOXES tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_PARTIALCHECKBOXES
member.summary: Adds a checkbox icon on the leftmost side of a given item with a square in the center, that indicates that the node is partially selected. Must be combined with NSTCS_CHECKBOXES. Maps to the TVS_EX_PARTIALCHECKBOXES tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_EXCLUSIONCHECKBOXES
member.summary: Adds a checkbox icon on the leftmost side of a given item that contains a red X, which indicates that the item is excluded from the current selection. Without this exclusion icon, selection of a parent item includes selection of its child items. Must be combined with NSTCS_CHECKBOXES. Maps to the TVS_EX_EXCLUSIONCHECKBOXES tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_DIMMEDCHECKBOXES
member.summary: Adds a checkbox on the leftmost side of a given item that contains an icon of a dimmed check mark, that indicates that a node is selected because its parent is selected. Must be combined with NSTCS_CHECKBOXES. Maps to the TVS_EX_DIMMEDCHECKBOXES tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_NOINDENTCHECKS
member.summary: Check boxes are located at the far left edge of the window area instead of being indented. Maps to the TVS_EX_NOINDENTSTATE tree view control style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_ALLOWJUNCTIONS
member.summary: Allow junctions. A junction point, or just junction, is a root of a namespace extension that is normally displayed by Windows Explorer as a folder in both tree and folder views. For Windows Explorer to display your extension's files and subfolders, you must specify where the root folder is located in the Shell namespace hierarchy. Junctions exist in the file system as files, but are not treated as files. An example is a compressed file with a .zip file name extension, which to the file system is just a file. However, if this file is treated as a junction, it can represent an entire namespace. This allows the namespace tree control to treat compressed files and similar junctions as folders rather than as files.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_SHOWTABSBUTTON
member.summary: Displays an arrow on the right side of an item if the item is a folder. The action associated with the arrow is implementation specific. Cannot be combined with NSTCS_SHOWDELETEBUTTON or NSTCS_SHOWREFRESHBUTTON.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_SHOWDELETEBUTTON
member.summary: Displays a red X on the right side of an item. The action associated with the X is implementation specific. Cannot be combined with NSTCS_SHOWTABSBUTTON or NSTCS_SHOWREFRESHBUTTON.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE.NSTCS_SHOWREFRESHBUTTON
member.summary: Displays a refresh button on the right side of an item. The action associated with the button is implementation specific. Cannot be combined with NSTCS_SHOWTABSBUTTON or NSTCS_SHOWDELETEBUTTON.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE2
member.summary: Used by methods of the INameSpaceTreeControl2 to specify extended display styles in a Shell namespace treeview.
member.remarks: The value NSTCS2_ALLMASK can be used to mask for the NSTCS2_INTERRUPTNOTIFICATIONS, NSTCS2_SHOWNULLSPACEMENU, and NSTCS2_DISPLAYPADDING values.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE2.NSTCS2_DEFAULT
member.summary: Displays the tree nodes in default mode, which includes none of the following values.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE2.NSTCS2_INTERRUPTNOTIFICATIONS
member.summary: Displays interrupt notifications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE2.NSTCS2_SHOWNULLSPACEMENU
member.summary: Displays the context menu in the padding space.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE2.NSTCS2_DISPLAYPADDING
member.summary: Inserts spacing (padding) between top-level nodes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE2.NSTCS2_DISPLAYPINNEDONLY
member.summary: Filters items based on the System.IsPinnedToNameSpaceTree value when INameSpaceTreeControlFolderCapabilities is implemented.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE2.NTSCS2_NEVERINSERTNONENUMERATED
member.summary: Do not insert nonenumerated (SFGAO_NONENUMERATED) items in the tree.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeAccessible
member.summary: Exposes methods that perform accessibility actions on a Shell item from a namespace tree control.
member.remarks: This interface is used only by INameSpaceTreeControl (CLSID_NameSpaceTreeControl).

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeAccessible.OnGetDefaultAccessibilityAction(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the default accessibility action for a Shell item.

param.name: pbstrDefaultAction
param.para: When this method returns, contains a BSTR that specifies the default, accessibility action.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or E_OUTOFMEMORY otherwise.

member.remarks: This method is called when the default accessibililty action for a Shell item is retrieved.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeAccessible.OnDoDefaultAccessibilityAction(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem)
member.summary: Invokes the default accessibility action on a Shell item.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeAccessible.OnGetAccessibilityRole(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,System.Object@)
member.summary: Gets the accessibility role for a Shell item.

param.name: pvarRole
param.para: When this method returns, contains a VARIANT that specifies the role.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: This method is called when the accessibility role for a Shell item is retrieved.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl
member.summary: Exposes methods used to view and manipulate nodes in a tree of Shell items.
member.remarks: To implement this interface use class ID CLSID_NameSpaceTreeControl.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.Initialize(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE)
member.summary: Initializes an INameSpaceTreeControl object.

param.name: hwndParent
param.para: The handle of the parent window.

param.name: prc
param.para: A pointer to a RECT structure that describes the size and position of the control in the client window.

param.name: nsctsFlags
param.para: The characteristics of the given namespace tree control. One or more of the following values from the NSTCSTYLE enumeration.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.TreeAdvise(System.Object,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Enables a client to register with the control.

param.name: punk
param.para: A pointer to the client IUnknown that registers with the control.

param.name: pdwCookie
param.para: A pointer to the cookie that is passed back for registration.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: The pointer to the cookie that is passed back is used to unregister the control later with INameSpaceTreeControl::TreeUnadvise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.TreeUnadvise(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Enables a client to unregister with the control.

param.name: dwCookie
param.para: A pointer to the cookie that is to be unregistered.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: The pointer to the cookie that is passed in is the one that was passed back in INameSpaceTreeControl::TreeAdvise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.AppendRoot(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCROOTSTYLE,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItemFilter)
member.summary: Appends a Shell item to the list of roots in a tree.

param.name: psiRoot
param.para: Pointer to the Shell item that is being appended.

param.name: grfEnumFlags
param.para: Enumerates the qualities of the root and all of its children. One or more of the values of type SHCONTF. These flags can be combined using a bitwise OR.

param.name: grfRootStyle
param.para: Specifies the style of the root that is being appended. One or more of the following values:
The root is visible as well as the items. Mutually exclusive with NSTCRS_HIDDEN.
The root is hidden so that the children only are visible. Mutually exclusive with NSTCRS_VISIBLE.
The root is expanded upon initialization.

param.name: pif
param.para: Pointer to the IShellItemFilter that enables you to filter which items in the tree are displayed. If supplied, every item is customizable with a SHCONTF flag. This value can be NULL if no filter is required.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.InsertRoot(System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCROOTSTYLE,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItemFilter)
member.summary: Inserts a Shell item on a root item in a tree.

param.name: iIndex
param.para: The index at which to insert the root.

param.name: psiRoot
param.para: A pointer to the Shell item that is being inserted.

param.name: grfEnumFlags
param.para: Enumerates the qualities of the root and all of its children. One of the values of type SHCONTF.

param.name: grfRootStyle
param.para: The style of the root that is being inserted. One or more of the following values (flags can be combined using a bitwise OR).
The root is visible as well as the items. Mutually exclusive with NSTCRS_HIDDEN.
The root is hidden so that only the children are visible. Mutually exclusive with NSTCRS_VISIBLE.
The root is expanded upon initialization.

param.name: pif
param.para: A pointer to the IShellItemFilter that enables you to filter which items in the tree are displayed. If supplied, every item is customizable with a SHCONTF flag. This value can be NULL if no filter is required.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.RemoveRoot(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem)
member.summary: Removes a root and its children from a tree.

param.name: psiRoot
param.para: A pointer to the root that is to be removed.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.RemoveAllRoots
member.summary: Removes all roots and their children from a tree.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.GetRootItems(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItemArray@)
member.summary: Gets an array of the root items.

param.name: ppsiaRootItems
param.para: A pointer to an array of root items.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.SetItemState(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCITEMSTATE,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCITEMSTATE)
member.summary: Sets state information for a Shell item.

param.name: psi
param.para: A pointer to the Shell item for which to set the state.

param.name: nstcisMask
param.para: Specifies which information is being set, in the form of a bitmap. One or more of the NSTCITEMSTATE constants.

param.name: nstcisFlags
param.para: A bitmap that contains the values to set for the flags specified in nstcisMask.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: The nstcisMask value specifies which bits in the value pointed to by pnstcisFlags are to be set. Other bits are ignored. As a simple example, if nstcisMask=NSTCIS_SELECTED, then the first bit in the nstcisFlags value determines whether that flag is set (1) or removed (0).

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.GetItemState(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCITEMSTATE,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCITEMSTATE@)
member.summary: Gets state information about a Shell item.

param.name: psi
param.para: A pointer to the Shell item from which to retrieve the state.

param.name: nstcisMask
param.para: Specifies which information is being requested, in the form of a bitmap. One or more of the NSTCITEMSTATE constants.

param.name: pnstcisFlags
param.para: When this method returns, points to a bitmap that contains the values requested in nstcisMask.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: The nstcisMask value specifies which bits in the value pointed to by pnstcisFlags are requested. As a simple example, if nstcisMask=NSTCIS_SELECTED, then only the first bit in the value pointed to by pnstcisFlags is valid when this method returns. If the first bit in the value pointed to by pnstcisFlags is 1, then the NSTCIS_SELECTED flag is set. If the first bit in the value pointed to by pnstcisFlags is 0, then the NSTCIS_SELECTED flag is not set.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.GetNextItem(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCGNI,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem@)
member.summary: Retrieves the next item in the tree according to which method is requested.

param.name: psi
param.para: The Shell item for which the next item is being retrieved. This value can be NULL.

param.name: nstcgi
param.para: The type of the next item. This value can be one of the following flags:
The next sibling of the given item.
The next visible item in the tree that has any relationship to the given item. This includes a child (if there is one), the next sibling, or even one of the ancestor's siblings.
The previous sibling item of the given item.
The previous visible item that is a sibling item, sibling descendent item or a parent item.
The parent item of the given item.
The first child item of the given item.
The absolute first visible item in the tree (not relative to the given item).
The absolute last visible item in the tree (not relative to the given item).

param.name: ppsiNext
param.para: The address of a pointer to the IShellItem that fits the criteria for the next item that was requested.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: If there is no next item for the type selected, this function returns E_FAIL with NULL for the returned item, ppsiNext.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl.HitTest(System.Drawing.Point@,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem@)
member.summary: Retrieves the item that a given point is in, if any.

param.name: ppt
param.para: A pointer to the point to be tested.

param.name: ppsiOut
param.para: The address of a pointer to the item in which the point exists, or NULL if the point does not exist in an item.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: This function returns S_FALSE with a NULL item if the point does not exist in an item.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl2
member.summary: Extends the INameSpaceTreeControl interface by providing methods that get and set the display styles of treeview controls for use with Shell namespace items.

remarks.para: This interface also provides the methods of the INameSpaceTreeControl interface, from which it inherits.
Use class identifier (CLSID) CLSID_NameSpaceTreeControl to instantiate an instance of this interface.
When to Implement
An implementation of this interface is provided with Windows. Third parties should not implement their own versions.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl2.Initialize(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE)
member.summary: Initializes an INameSpaceTreeControl object.

param.name: hwndParent
param.para: The handle of the parent window.

param.name: prc
param.para: A pointer to a RECT structure that describes the size and position of the control in the client window.

param.name: nsctsFlags
param.para: The characteristics of the given namespace tree control. One or more of the following values from the NSTCSTYLE enumeration.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl2.TreeAdvise(System.Object,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Enables a client to register with the control.

param.name: punk
param.para: A pointer to the client IUnknown that registers with the control.

param.name: pdwCookie
param.para: A pointer to the cookie that is passed back for registration.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: The pointer to the cookie that is passed back is used to unregister the control later with INameSpaceTreeControl::TreeUnadvise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl2.TreeUnadvise(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Enables a client to unregister with the control.

param.name: dwCookie
param.para: A pointer to the cookie that is to be unregistered.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: The pointer to the cookie that is passed in is the one that was passed back in INameSpaceTreeControl::TreeAdvise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl2.AppendRoot(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCROOTSTYLE,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItemFilter)
member.summary: Appends a Shell item to the list of roots in a tree.

param.name: psiRoot
param.para: Pointer to the Shell item that is being appended.

param.name: grfEnumFlags
param.para: Enumerates the qualities of the root and all of its children. One or more of the values of type SHCONTF. These flags can be combined using a bitwise OR.

param.name: grfRootStyle
param.para: Specifies the style of the root that is being appended. One or more of the following values:
The root is visible as well as the items. Mutually exclusive with NSTCRS_HIDDEN.
The root is hidden so that the children only are visible. Mutually exclusive with NSTCRS_VISIBLE.
The root is expanded upon initialization.

param.name: pif
param.para: Pointer to the IShellItemFilter that enables you to filter which items in the tree are displayed. If supplied, every item is customizable with a SHCONTF flag. This value can be NULL if no filter is required.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl2.InsertRoot(System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCROOTSTYLE,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItemFilter)
member.summary: Inserts a Shell item on a root item in a tree.

param.name: iIndex
param.para: The index at which to insert the root.

param.name: psiRoot
param.para: A pointer to the Shell item that is being inserted.

param.name: grfEnumFlags
param.para: Enumerates the qualities of the root and all of its children. One of the values of type SHCONTF.

param.name: grfRootStyle
param.para: The style of the root that is being inserted. One or more of the following values (flags can be combined using a bitwise OR).
The root is visible as well as the items. Mutually exclusive with NSTCRS_HIDDEN.
The root is hidden so that only the children are visible. Mutually exclusive with NSTCRS_VISIBLE.
The root is expanded upon initialization.

param.name: pif
param.para: A pointer to the IShellItemFilter that enables you to filter which items in the tree are displayed. If supplied, every item is customizable with a SHCONTF flag. This value can be NULL if no filter is required.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.summary: Removes a root and its children from a tree.

param.name: psiRoot
param.para: A pointer to the root that is to be removed.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl2.SetControlStyle(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE)
member.summary: Sets the display styles for the namespace object's treeview controls.

param.name: nstcsMask
param.para: One or more of the NSTCSTYLE constants that specify the styles for which the method should set new values.

param.name: nstcsStyle
param.para: A bitmap that contains the new values for the styles specified in nstcsMask. If the bit that represents the individual NSTCSTYLE value is 0, that style is not used. If the value is 1, the style is applied to the treeview. Styles in positions not specified in nstcsMask are left at their current setting regardless of their bit's value in this bitmap.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl2.GetControlStyle(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE@)
member.summary: Gets the display styles set for the namespace object's treeview controls.

param.name: nstcsMask
param.para: One or more of the NSTCSTYLE constants that specify the values for which the method should retrieve the current settings.

param.name: pnstcsStyle
param.para: Pointer to a value that, when this method returns successfully, receives the values requested in nstcsMask. If the bit that represents the individual NSTCSTYLE value is 0, that value is not set. If the value is 1, it is the current setting. Bit values in positions not specifically requested in nstcsMask do not necessarily reflect the current settings and should not be used.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl2.SetControlStyle2(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE2,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE2)
member.summary: Sets the extended display styles for the namespace object's treeview controls.

param.name: nstcsMask
param.para: One or more of the NSTCSTYLE2 constants that specify the styles for which the method should set new values.

param.name: nstcsStyle
param.para: A bitmap that contains the new values for the styles specified in nstcsMask. If the bit that represents the individual NSTCSTYLE2 value is 0, that style is not used. If the value is 1, the style is applied to the treeview. Styles in positions not specified in nstcsMask are left at their current setting regardless of their bit's value in this bitmap.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControl2.GetControlStyle2(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE2,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCSTYLE2@)
member.summary: Gets the extended display styles set for the namespace object's treeview controls.

param.name: nstcsMask
param.para: One or more of the NSTCSTYLE2 constants that specify the values for which the method should retrieve the current settings.

param.name: pnstcsStyle
param.para: Pointer to a value that, when this method returns successfully, receives the values requested in nstcsMask. If the bit that represents the individual NSTCSTYLE2 value is 0, that value is not set. If the value is 1, it is the current setting. Bit values in positions not specifically requested in nstcsMask do not necessarily reflect the current settings and should not be used.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControlDropHandler
member.summary: Exposes handler methods for drag-and-drop. Used by the namespace tree control to notify the client of any drag-and-drop operation happening within the control. Provides a way for a client to intercept a drop operation and perform its own action, or to return the desired drop effect.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControlDropHandler.OnDragEnter(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItemArray,System.Boolean,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Called on drag enter to set drag effect, as specified.

param.name: psiOver
param.para: A pointer to an IShellItem interface representing the item underneath the mouse cursor. Optional.

param.name: psiaData
param.para: A pointer to an IShellItem array containing the items being dragged.

param.name: fOutsideSource
param.para: Specifies whether drag started outside target area.

param.name: grfKeyState
param.para: The current state of keyboard modifier keys.

param.name: pdwEffect
param.para: On success, contains a pointer to the drag effect value.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: Failing this method blocks the drag operation in the namespace tree control (NSTC).

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControlDropHandler.OnDragOver(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItemArray,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Called on drag over to set drag effect, as specified.

param.name: psiOver
param.para: A pointer to an IShellItem interface representing the item underneath the mouse cursor. Optional.

param.name: psiaData
param.para: A pointer to an IShellItem array containing the items being dragged.

param.name: grfKeyState
param.para: The current state of keyboard modifier keys.

param.name: pdwEffect
param.para: On success, contains a pointer to the drag effect value.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: Failing this method blocks the drag operation in the namespace tree control (NSTC).

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControlDropHandler.OnDragPosition(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItemArray,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when the item is being dragged within the same level (within the same parent folder) in the tree.

param.name: psiOver
param.para: A pointer to an IShellItem interface representing the item underneath the mouse cursor. Optional.

param.name: psiaData
param.para: A pointer to an IShellItem array containing the items being dragged.

param.name: iNewPosition
param.para: The index if the item being dragged is between items; otherwise, NSTCDHPOS_ONTOP (-1).

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: Failing this method prevents the item rearrangment.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControlDropHandler.OnDrop(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItemArray,System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Called on drop to set drop effect, as specified.

param.name: psiOver
param.para: A pointer to an IShellItem interface representing the item underneath the mouse cursor. Optional.

param.name: psiaData
param.para: A pointer to an IShellItem array representing a data object.

param.name: grfKeyState
param.para: The current state of keyboard modifier keys.

param.name: pdwEffect
param.para: A pointer to the drop effect value.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: Note To overwrite the default drop behavior, a client should fail this method; success proceeds with the default drop operation.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControlDropHandler.OnDropPosition(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItemArray,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when the item is being dropped within the same level (within the same parent folder) in the tree.

param.name: psiOver
param.para: A pointer to an IShellItem interface representing the item underneath the mouse cursor. Optional.

param.name: psiaData

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: Failing this method prevents the item rearrangment from happening.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControlEvents
member.summary: Exposes methods for handling INameSpaceTreeControl events.
member.remarks: This interface is implemented by a client of namespace control (CLSID_NameSpaceTreeControl) to be advised of namespace control events so that the client may process these events and if not, allow the namespace control to process them.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControlEvents.OnItemClick(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellItem,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCEHITTEST,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCECLICKTYPE)
member.summary: Called when the user clicks a button on the mouse.

param.name: nstceHitTest
param.para: The location on the IShellItem that was clicked. One of the following values:
The click was on the icon of the IShellItem.
The click was on the label text of the IShellItem.
The click was on the indented space on the leftmost side of the IShellItem.
The click was on the expando button of the IShellItem.
The click was on the rightmost side of the text of the IShellItem.
The click was on the state icon of the IShellItem.
The click was on the item icon or the item label or the state icon of the IShellItem.
The click was on the tab button of the IShellItem.

param.name: nstceClickType
param.para: Indicates which button was clicked and the kind of click. One of the following values:
The click was a double click. If this value is present, it is added to one of the other values.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: If this method fails, the event is processed by both INameSpaceTreeControl and TreeView. If it returns S_OK, then only INameSpaceTreeControl will process the event.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControlFolderCapabilities
member.summary: Exposes a single method that retrieves the status of a folder's System.IsPinnedToNameSpaceTree filtering support.

remarks.para: The namespace tree control checks all the nodes it enumerates to see if they support filtering. This is done by retrieving the System.IsPinnedToNameSpaceTree property for the shell folders that support this interface. Nodes that do not support this interface do not have filtering support and are shown by default.
Use this interface to retrieve the filtering support status of a shell folder.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INameSpaceTreeControlFolderCapabilities.GetFolderCapabilities(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCFOLDERCAPABILITIES,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NSTCFOLDERCAPABILITIES@)
member.summary: Gets a folder's capability to be filtered through the System.IsPinnedToNameSpaceTree property key value and change notification registration status.

param.name: nfcMask
param.para: The capabilities for which this method should retrieve values. Specify one or both of the following:
0x00000001. The System.IsPinnedToNameSpaceTree property exists on this folder and filtering based on that property value is supported.
0x00000002. Registration for change notifications is delayed until the folder is expanded in the navigation pane.

param.name: pnfcValue
param.para: Pointer to a value that, when this method returns successfully, receives the capabilities requested in nfcMask. Except in the case of NSTCFC_NONE, bit values in positions not specifically requested in nfcMask do not necessarily reflect the capabilities and should not be used.
0x00000000. The System.IsPinnedToNameSpaceTree property does not exist on this folder. Filtering is not supported.
0x00000001. The System.IsPinnedToNameSpaceTree property exists on this folder and filtering based on that property value is supported.
0x00000002. Registration for change notifications is delayed until the folder is expanded in the navigation pane.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NameSpaceTreeControl
member.summary: CLSID_NameSpaceTreeControl

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG
member.summary: Flags that control the walk operation.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_DEFAULT
member.summary: Use this value when you do not want to set any of the other flags.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_NONE_IMPLIES_ALL
member.summary:
Collect all of the items in the folder if both of these criteria are met:
punkToWalk is a folder (IShellFolder or IShellView).
None of the items in the folder are currently selected.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_ONE_IMPLIES_ALL
member.summary:
Collect all of the items in the folder if both of these criteria are met:
punkToWalk is a folder (IShellFolder or IShellView).
One of the items in the folder is currently selected.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_DONT_TRAVERSE_LINKS
member.summary: Do not follow links (.lnk, .url, and folder shortcuts) in the recursion; instead, return them as regular items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_DONT_ACCUMULATE_RESULT
member.summary: Do not collect the PIDLs of the nodes during the namespace walk.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_TRAVERSE_STREAM_JUNCTIONS
member.summary: Include the contents of stream junction points in the walk. For instance, walk into the contents of a .cab file.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_FILESYSTEM_ONLY
member.summary: Walk only file system nodes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_SHOW_PROGRESS
member.summary: Display a dialog box with a progress bar while walking the namespace.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_FLAG_VIEWORDER
member.summary: Return items in view order. This applies only when punkToWalk is an IShellView object.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_IGNORE_AUTOPLAY_HIDA
member.summary: Do not use the AutoPlay HIDA in the data object. This applies only when punkToWalk is an IDataObject object.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_ASYNC
member.summary: Perform the walk asynchronously by running it on a background thread.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_DONT_RESOLVE_LINKS
member.summary: Traverse links to return their targets (for .lnk, .url and folder shortcuts) but do not verify that those targets exist (Resolve). This is an optimization and does not affect the results except in the case where a missing or moved target could be found and returned.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_ACCUMULATE_FOLDERS
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_DONT_SORT
member.summary: Do not maintain the sort order of the items being walked.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_USE_TRANSFER_MEDIUM
member.summary: Use SHCONTF_STORAGE in enumerations

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_DONT_TRAVERSE_STREAM_JUNCTIONS
member.summary: For items with both SFGAO_FOLDER and SFGAO_STREAM passed to the walk (as opposed to those discovered by walking), for example .zip, .search-ms and .library-ms files do not traverse them, instead treat them as items. this will result in FoundItem() callbacks instead of EnterFolder()/LeaveFolder()

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG.NSWF_ANY_IMPLIES_ALL
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INamespaceWalk
member.summary: Exposes methods that walk a namespace from a given root node. The depth of the walk is specified and an optional array is returned containing the IDs of all nodes walked.

remarks.para: Use this interface to display or perform an operation on the contents of the namespace. INamespaceWalk allows retrieval of all reachable nodes of your namespace as pointers to item identifier lists (PIDLs), which can in turn be used to retrieve the IShellFolder object for each.

The class identifier (CLSID) for the default implementation of INamespaceWalk is CLSID_NamespaceWalker. You can obtain an INamespaceWalk object by creating a single uninitialized object of the class associated with CLSID_NamespaceWalker using CoCreateInstance. This interface's IID is IID_INamespaceWalk.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INamespaceWalk.Walk(System.Object,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.NAMESPACEWALKFLAG,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INamespaceWalkCB)
member.summary: Initiates a recursive walk of the namespace from the specified root to the given depth.

param.name: punkToWalk
param.para: The root node from which to begin the walk. This can be represented by one of the following objects.
as the root allows the possibility of walking the entire Windows namespace if

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: One or more of the following flags that control the walk operation.
Use this value when you do not want to set any of the other flags.
Collect all of the items in the folder if both of these criteria are met:

item.term: punkToWalk is a folder (IShellFolder or IShellView).
None of the items in the folder are currently selected.

param.para: Collect all of the items in the folder if both of these criteria are met:

item.term: punkToWalk is a folder (IShellFolder or IShellView).
One of the items in the folder is currently selected.

param.para: Do not follow links (.lnk, .url, and folder shortcuts) in the recursion; instead, return them as regular items.
Do not collect the PIDLs of the nodes during the namespace walk.
Include the contents of stream junction points in the walk. For instance, walk into the contents of a .cab file.
Display a dialog box with a progress bar while walking the namespace.
Return items in view order. This applies only when punkToWalk is an IShellView object.
Do not use the AutoPlay HIDA in the data object. This applies only when punkToWalk is an IDataObject object.
Perform the walk asynchronously by running it on a background thread.

Traverse links to return their targets (for .lnk, .url and folder shortcuts) but do not verify that those targets exist (Resolve). This is an optimization and does not affect the results except in the case where a missing or moved target could be found and returned.
Do not maintain the sort order of the items being walked.

param.name: cDepth
param.para: The maximum depth to descend through the namespace hierarchy. This depth is zero-based. Set to 0 to walk only the folder identified by punkToWalk but none of its subfolders.

param.name: pnswcb
param.para: INamespaceWalkCB callback function used by INamespaceWalk. This parameter can be NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INamespaceWalk.GetIDArrayResult(System.UInt32@,System.IntPtr[])
member.summary: Gets a list of objects found during a namespace walk initiated by INamespaceWalk::Walk.

param.name: pcItems
param.para: The number of items stored in pppidl

param.name: prgpidl
param.para: The address of a pointer to an array of PIDLs representing the items found during the namespace walk.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use INamespaceWalk::GetIDArrayResult, NSWF_DONT_ACCUMULATE_RESULT cannot be specified in the call to INamespaceWalk::Walk.
It is the responsibility of the calling application to free this array. Call CoTaskMemFree for each PIDL as well as once for the array itself.
Examples

The following example creates the INamespaceWalk instance, begins the walk at the desktop, walks only the desktop folder and its immediate children, retrieves the PIDLs retrived in the walk, and frees their array.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INamespaceWalkCB
member.summary: A callback interface exposing methods used with INamespaceWalk. After performing a walk with INamespaceWalk, an IShellFolder object representing the walked nodes is passed to the INamespaceWalkCB methods. What those methods do with the information depends on the object that is implementing them.
member.remarks: The IID for this interface is IID_INamespaceWalkCB.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INamespaceWalkCB.FoundItem(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellFolder,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Called when an object is found in the namespace during a namespace walk. Use this method as the main action function for the class implementing it. Perform your actions as needed inside this method.

param.name: psf
param.para: A pointer to an IShellFolder object representing the folder containing the item.

param.name: pidl
param.para: The item's PIDL, relative to psf.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.summary: Called when a folder is about to be entered during a namespace walk. Use this method for any initialization of the retrieved item.

param.name: psf
param.para: A pointer to an IShellFolder object representing the parent of the folder designated by pidl.

param.name: pidl
param.para: The PIDL, relative to psf, of the folder being entered.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.INamespaceWalkCB.LeaveFolder(Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IShellFolder,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Called after a namespace walk through a folder. Use this method to perform any necessary cleanup following the actions performed by INamespaceWalkCB::EnterFolder or INamespaceWalkCB::FoundItem.

param.name: psf
param.para: A pointer to an IShellFolder object representing the parent of the folder designated by pidl.

param.name: pidl
param.para: A PIDL, relative to psf, of the folder being exited.

remarks.para: When to Implement
This interface is implemented by verbs that implement IExecuteCommand. This allows objects to invoke the verb on the selection through IExecuteCommand::Execute.
When to Use
IObjectWithSelection is used by Windows Explorer to invoke a verb on the selected items. Do not call this interface directly.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: We recommend that you use the IID_PPV_ARGS macro, defined in Objbase.h, to package the riid and ppv parameters. This macro provides the correct IID based on the interface pointed to by the value in ppv, which eliminates the possibility of a coding error in riid that could lead to unexpected results.

summary.para: Exposes methods that allow implementers of a custom IAssocHandler object to provide access to its explicit Application User Model ID (AppUserModelID). This information is used to determine whether a particular file type can be added to an application's Jump List.

remarks.para: Only file types for which an application is a registered handler appear in that application's Jump List. When an application uses an explicit AppUserModelID to identify itself and the windows and processes that belong to it, that AppUserModelID must also be set in a handler's implementation so that the handler is recognized as being associated with that application. When the application accesses a file such that SHAddToRecentDocs is called as a result, an attempt is made to add the file to the Recent or Frequent category, or possibly a custom category, in that application's Jump List. If the application is a registered handler for that file type, identified as such by the handler's AppUserModelID matching the application's AppUserModelID, that file is added to the Jump List. If not, it is filtered and does not appear.
When to Implement

An implementation of this interface is provided in Windows. Applications that create custom Shell folders that expose an association handler enumeration needed by the system to determine the files allowed in the application's Jump List should implement their own versions.
When to Use
This object is needed only if your application is using explicit AppUserModelIDs. Without an explicit AppUserModelID to expose, there is no need for this object.
IObjectWithAppUserModelID is always used as part of a larger object that uses explicit AppUserModelIDs and wants to expose that information to the system.
The system calls the IObjectWithAppUserModelID::GetAppID method implemented on a handler to determine whether the application is a registered handler for a file type.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IObjectWithAppUserModelId.SetAppID(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies a unique application-defined Application User Model ID (AppUserModelID) that identifies the object as a handler for a specific file type. This method is used by applications that require dynamic AppUserModelIDs.

param.name: pszAppID
param.para: A pointer to the AppUserModelID string to assign to an application.

returns.para: Custom implementations that do not require dynamic AppUserModelIDs can return E_NOTIMPL. Custom implementations that require dynamic AppUserModelIDs should return S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise.

summary.para: Retrieves a file type handler's explicit Application User Model ID (AppUserModelID), if one has been declared.

param.name: ppszAppID
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of the AppUserModelID string assigned to the object.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method can only retrieve an AppUserModelID explicitly set for the handler. If the handler did not register an explicit AppUserModelID and is relying on a system-assigned AppUserModelID, this method will not retrieve the AppUserModelID. For more information, see Application User Model IDs (AppUserModelIDs).

summary.para: Provides a simple way to support communication between an object and its site in the container.

Often an object needs to communicate directly with a container site object and, in effect, manage the site object itself. Outside of IOleObject::SetClientSite, there is no generic means through which an object becomes aware of its site. IObjectWithSite provides simple objects with a simple siting mechanism (lighter than IOleObject) This interface should only be used when IOleObject is not already in use.

Through IObjectWithSite, a container can pass the IUnknown pointer of its site to the object through IObjectWithSite::SetSite. Callers can also retrieve the latest site passed to SetSite through IObjectWithSite::GetSite. This latter method is included as a hooking mechanism, allowing a third party to intercept calls from the object to the site.
Enables a container to pass an object a pointer to the interface for its site.

param.name: pUnkSite
param.para: A pointer to the IUnknown interface pointer of the site managing this object. If NULL, the object should call Release on any existing site at which point the object no longer knows its site.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success.

remarks.para: The object should hold onto this pointer, calling IUnknown::AddRef in doing so. If the object already has a site, it should call that existing site's IUnknown::Release, save the new site pointer, and call the new site's IUnknown::AddRef.
E_NOTIMPL is not allowed without implementation of the SetSite method, the IObjectWithSite interface is unnecessary.

summary.para: Retrieves the latest site passed using SetSite.

param.name: riid
param.para: The IID of the interface pointer that should be returned in .

param.name: ppvSite
param.para: Address of pointer variable that receives the interface pointer requested in . Upon successful return, * contains the requested interface pointer to the site last seen in SetSite. The specific interface returned depends on the argument in essence, the two arguments act identically to those in QueryInterface. If the appropriate interface pointer is available, the object must call AddRef on that pointer before returning successfully. If no site is available, or the requested interface is not supported, this method must * to NULL and return a failure code.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

item.term: There is no site, in which case * contains NULL on return.
There is a site, but it does not support the interface requested by .

remarks.para: E_NOTIMPL is not allowed any object implementing this interface must be able to return the last site seen in IObjectWithSite::SetSite.

member.summary: Extension method to simplify using the method.

member.param: An instance.
member.returns: Receives the interface pointer requested in .

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IOperationsProgressDialog
member.summary: Exposes methods to get, set, and query a progress dialog.

summary.para: Starts the specified progress dialog.

param.name: hwndOwner
param.para: A handle to the parent window.

remarks.para: The progress dialog should be created on a separate thread than the file operation on which the dialog is reporting. If the dialog is running in the same thread as the file operation, progress messages are, at best, only sent as resources allow. Progress messages on the same thread as the file operation might not be sent at all.

Once IOperationsProgressDialog::StartProgressDialog is called, that instance of the CLSID_ProgressDialog object cannot be accessed by IProgressDialog, IActionProgressDialog, or IActionProgress. Although QueryInterface can be used to access these interfaces, most of their methods cannot be invoked. IOperationsProgressDialog is the interface used to display the new progress dialog for the Windows Vista and later operations engine.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IOperationsProgressDialog.StopProgressDialog
member.summary: Stops current progress dialog.

summary.para: Sets which progress dialog operation is occurring, and whether we are in pre-flight or undo mode.
Sets progress dialog operations mode.

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies the operation mode. The following are valid values.
0x00000000. Use the default progress dialog operations mode.
0x00000002. The operation is gathering data before it begins, such as calculating the predicted operation time.
0x00000004. The operation is rolling back due to an Undo command from the user.
0x00000008. Error dialogs are blocking progress from continuing.
0x00000010. The length of the operation is indeterminate. Do not show a timer and display the progress bar in marquee mode.

param.para: Total size in bytes, used for showing progress in bytes.

param.para: Current items, used for showing progress in items.

param.name: ullItemsTotal
param.para: Specifies total items, used for showing progress in items.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IParentAndItem
member.summary: Exposes methods that get and set the parent and the parent's child ID. While IParentAndItem is typically implemented on IShellItems, it is not specific to IShellItem.
member.remarks: The performance improvement using this interface can be noted in comparison with IPersistIDList, an interface that uses absolute item identifier lists. Subsequent operations on objects that implement IPersistIDList may require IShellFolder::BindToObject calls, and these calls may impact performance. In the case of IShellItems and participating IShellFolders that implement IParentAndItem, the parent IShellFolder may already be cached. By implementing IParentAndItem and then getting/setting the parent IShellFolder directly, the call to IShellFolder::BindToObject on the item identifier list to retrieve the IShellFolder interface is eliminated.

param.para: A PIDL that is a child relative to psf.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.remarks: While IParentAndItem is typically implemented on IShellItems, it is not specific to IShellItem.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.IPreviousVersionsInfo.AreSnapshotsAvailable(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Queries for the availablilty of a Windows Server 2003 volume image recorded by the system at an earlier time.

param.name: pszPath
param.para: A null-terminated Unicode string containing the fully qualified path to a file or folder on the volume in question.

param.name: fOkToBeSlow
param.para: A boolean value specifying whether a server should be contacted to determine the availability of stored volume images. For more details, see the Remarks section.
Contact the server if the results are not already cached.
Do not contact the server. Use cached results instead.

returns.para: A pointer to a boolean variable containing the result. This value is valid only if the method call succeeds; otherwise, it is undefined.
At least one stored image of the volume where the file or folder named in pszPath resides is available.

remarks.para: If IPreviousVersionsInfo::AreSnapshotsAvailable is called on a file or folder, the result does not indicate that rollback information is available for that specific file or folder, merely that a snapshot of the entire volume is available. This result is cached and subsequent calls inquiring about anything stored on that same volume access the cached resultswith little performance overheadinstead of recontacting the server.

Once the server's response is cached in memory, subsequent calls do not contact the server even if fOkToBeSlow is TRUE. If fOkToBeSlow is FALSE and the server's response is not already cached from a previous call, the method returns E_PENDING. In that case, set fOkToBeSlow to TRUE and call IPreviousVersionsInfo::AreSnapshotsAvailable again to contact the server.
For better performance, a UI thread calling this method should always set fOkToBeSlow to FALSE. If the method returns E_PENDING, follow these steps.

item.term: Create another instance of IPreviousVersionsInfo on a background thread.
Call IPreviousVersionsInfo::AreSnapshotsAvailable with fOkToBeSlow set to TRUE.
Signal the original UI thread to call IPreviousVersionsInfo::AreSnapshotsAvailable again. The results are then pulled from the cache.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.PreviousVersionsInfo
member.summary: CoClass for IPreviousVersionsInfo

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ISearchBoxInfo
member.summary: Exposes methods that allow the caller to retrieve information entered into a search box.

remarks.para: The search box is shown here in an Windows Explorer window frame.
The frame that contains the search box might also be hosted in another window or in the common file dialog box.
To access the search dialog, use QueryService using SID_SSearchBoxInfo on a site pointer within the Windows Explorer window.
When to Implement
An implementation of this interface is provided with Windows. Third parties do not need to implement their own version.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ISearchBoxInfo.GetCondition(System.Guid@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Retrieves the contents of the search box as an ICondition object.

param.name: riid
param.para: A reference to the IID of the interface to retrieve through ppv, typically IID_ICondition.

param.name: ppv
param.para: When this method returns successfully, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically ICondition.

remarks.para: As opposed to the text string retrieved by ISearchBoxInfo::GetText, GetCondition retrieves the same information as a structured object, the methods of which can be used to parse and manipulate the search string.

We recommend that you use the IID_PPV_ARGS macro, defined in Objbase.h, to package the riid and ppv parameters. This macro provides the correct IID based on the interface pointed to by the value in ppv, which eliminates the possibility of a coding error in riid that could lead to unexpected results.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.ISearchBoxInfo.GetText(Vanara.InteropServices.StrPtrUni@)
member.summary: Retrieves the contents of the search box as plain text.

param.name: ppsz
param.para: Pointer to a buffer that, when this method returns successfully, receives the full text entered in the search box.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF
member.summary: Determines the types of items included in an enumeration. These values are used with the IShellFolder::EnumObjects method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_CHECKING_FOR_CHILDREN
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The calling application is checking for the existence of child items in the folder.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FOLDERS
member.summary: Include items that are folders in the enumeration.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NONFOLDERS
member.summary: Include items that are not folders in the enumeration.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INCLUDEHIDDEN
member.summary: Include hidden items in the enumeration. This does not include hidden system items. (To include hidden system items, use SHCONTF_INCLUDESUPERHIDDEN.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INIT_ON_FIRST_NEXT
member.summary: No longer used; always assumed. IShellFolder::EnumObjects can return without validating the enumeration object. Validation can be postponed until the first call to IEnumIDList::Next. Use this flag when a user interface might be displayed prior to the first IEnumIDList::Next call. For a user interface to be presented, hwnd must be set to a valid window handle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NETPRINTERSRCH
member.summary: The calling application is looking for printer objects.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_SHAREABLE
member.summary: The calling application is looking for resources that can be shared.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_STORAGE
member.summary: Include items with accessible storage and their ancestors, including hidden items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NAVIGATION_ENUM
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Child folders should provide a navigation enumeration.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FASTITEMS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The calling application is looking for resources that can be enumerated quickly.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FLATLIST
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Enumerate items as a simple list even if the folder itself is not structured in that way.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_ENABLE_ASYNC
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The calling application is monitoring for change notifications. This means that the enumerator does not have to return all results. Items can be reported through change notifications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INCLUDESUPERHIDDEN
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Include hidden system items in the enumeration. This value does not include hidden non-system items. (To include hidden non-system items, use SHCONTF_INCLUDEHIDDEN.)

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHGDNF
member.summary: Defines the values used with the IShellFolder::GetDisplayNameOf and IShellFolder::SetNameOf methods to specify the type of file or folder names used by those methods.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHGDNF.SHGDN_FORADDRESSBAR
member.summary: The name is displayed in an address bar combo box.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHGDNF.SHGDN_FOREDITING
member.summary: The name is used for in-place editing when the user renames the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHGDNF.SHGDN_FORPARSING
member.summary: The name is used for parsing. That is, it can be passed to IShellFolder::ParseDisplayName to recover the object's PIDL. The form this name takes depends on the particular object. When SHGDN_FORPARSING is used alone, the name is relative to the desktop. When combined with SHGDN_INFOLDER, the name is relative to the folder from which the request was made.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHGDNF.SHGDN_INFOLDER
member.summary: The name is relative to the folder from which the request was made. This is the name display to the user when used in the context of the folder. For example, it is used in the view and in the address bar path segment for the folder. This name should not include disambiguation informationfor instance "username" instead of "username (on Machine)" for a particular user's folder. Use this flag in combinations with SHGDN_FORPARSING and SHGDN_FOREDITING.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Shell32.SHGDNF.SHGDN_NORMAL
member.summary: When not combined with another flag, return the parent-relative name that identifies the item, suitable for displaying to the user. This name often does not include extra information such as the file name extension and does not need to be unique. This name might include information that identifies the folder that contains the item. For instance, this flag could cause IShellFolder::GetDisplayNameOf to return the string "username (on Machine)" for a particular user's folder.

The number of objects actually enumerated. This may be less than celt.
